content:
ここ〔此処〕
〈名〉
1. This place:(=に) in this place; here:(=へ) here:(古文体にては)hither:(=から) from here:(古文体にては)hence; from hence:(=まで) here; so far; thus far

content.content: 彼はここにいる
He lives here.
ここが彼の居るところだ
This is where he lives―Here is where he lives.
僕の生まれたのはここだ
This is where I was born.
ここが即ち旧式と新式の分かれるところだ
this is where the old and new style differ
ここへ来給え
Come here!―Step this way!
ここにお誂い向きの人がある
Here is the very man for you.
そこはここからどれほどあるか
How far is it from here?
ここまで来れば安心だ
Here we are safe.
ここまでは追って来まい
They will not pursue us here.
ここまでお出で
Come here!
今日はここまでにしておこう
We shall leave off here today―That'll do for today.
ここまではよろしい
So far, so good.
ここまでは別に不都合は無い
Thus far, all is right.
彼はここの学校に教えている
He teaches the school here.
あれはここの人か
Does he belong here?
談ここに至って女は泣き出した
Here, the woman burst into tears.
ここにおいて一考した
Hereupon,―On this,―(これを見て、見て聞いての意味なら)―At this,―I considered.
ここ彼処{かしこ}に
here and there
ここかしこをさまよった
I wandered about here and there―up and down.
大きな原があってここかしこに人家や森が見える
There is a large plain, with here a village and there a wood.

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: (銭を出して)ここに置くよ
There you are!
この話はどうぞここきりに願います
But this is between ourselves.
ここきりの話だが彼はちとあやしいね
Between ourselves, he looks a little suspicious.
ここばかり日は照らぬ
The sun shines everywhere―I have all the world before me.
ここは思案のしどころ
I have come to a parting of the ways.
ここぞと思って言った
Thinking now was the time, I said...
ここぞと思う時に彼はへこたれた
He faltered at the supreme moment.
この本はここぞと思う点は無い
The book has no particular merit.
病人はここ暫くは全快しません
The invalid will not recover for some time yet.
ここ二三日のところが危ぶない
He will be in a critical state these two or three days.
こんな暑い年はここ五六年は無い
We have not such a hot summer these five or six years.
事ここに至らんとは
That things should come to this!
国を出でてここに五年
It is five years since I left home.
明治維新以来ここに六十年
It is sixty years since the Imperial rule was restored.
ここに田中という人がある
Now, there is a man, Tanaka by name.

女は小声でうんと言った
She murmured her consent.

こごえじに〔凍え死に〕
〈名〉Freezing to death:(=する) to freeze to death; to be frozen to death

content:
こごえる〔凍える〕
〈自動〉To be benumbed (with cold)

content.content: 手がこごえて書けぬ
My hands are benumbed, and I can not write.

content:
ここかしこ〔此処彼処〕
〈副〉Here and there

content.content: ここかしこをさまよった
I wandered about here and there―up and down.
大きな原があってここかしこに人家や森が見える
There is a large plain, with here a village and there a wood.

content:
ここく〔故国〕
〈名〉One's native country; one's native land; one's home

content.content: 故国を憶う
to long for home
故国を去ってここに十年
It is ten years since I left home.
僕は生きて故国に帰れまいと思う
I fear I shall never live to see my native land.

content:
ごこく〔五穀〕
〈名〉The cereals; the grains

content.content: 五穀豊熟す
The harvests are abundant.
五穀実らず
The harvests are bad―The crops are light.

content:
ごこく〔後刻〕
〈副〉Afterward; later on

content.content: 後刻またお目にかかります
I shall see you later on.

ごこくのかみ〔護国の神〕
〈名〉The tutelary deity of the land:(西洋では) a patron saint

content:
こごし〔小腰〕
〈名〉A slight bow

content.content: 小腰をかがめる
to make a slight bow―bow slightly

content:
ここち〔心地〕
〈名〉A feeling:(=する) to feel

content.content: 清々した心地がする
I feel fresh.
人はなんと言ってもどうしても本当でたまらないような心地する
Whatever others may say, I feel that it is true.
心地好き
comfortable―agreeable―pleasant
心地好き天気だ
It is agreeable weather―pleasant weather.
心地悪しき
uncomfortable―disagreeable―unpleasant
心地悪しき天気だ
It is disagreeable weather―unpleasant weather―beastly weather.
着心地の好い(悪い)着物
comfortable clothes―uncomfortable clothes
はき心地の好い(悪い)靴
comfortable shoes―uncomfortable shoes
居心地の好い部屋
a comfortable room―a snug room―a cosy room
住み心地の好い(悪い)家
a comfortable house―an uncomfortable house
寝心地の好い(悪い)寝台
a comfortable bed―an uncomfortable bed
昨夜は寝心地が好かった(悪かった)
I have slept well―slept badly.
あの時は生きた心地は無かった
I felt wretched.
天にも昇る心地
I was in the Seventh Heaven.
夢に夢みる心地
I lay in a trance.

content:
こごと〔小言〕
〈名〉A complaint; a scolding; a lecture; fault-finding; grumbling

content.content: 小言を言う

(叱るのなら)to give one a scolding―give one a rating―give me a piece of one's mind―rend one a lecture―blow one up―give it one―nag at one―din in one's ears―(とがめだてするのなら)―find fault with anything―quarrel with anything―(愚痴をこぼすのなら)―grumble at anything―complain of anything
お母さんが女中どもに小言を言っている
Mamma is blowing up the servants.
うんと小言を言ってやった
I gave him a sound rating.
今度来たなら一つ小言を言ってやろう
The next time he comes, I will give him a bit of my mind.
今度こんなことを仕やがったら小言を言ってやる
If he repears it, I'll give it him.
親父の長いお小言を聞いた
My father read me a long lecture.
継母は僕が何をしてもなんとかかとか小言を言った、箸の上げ下ろしにも小言を言うのであった
My stepmother would find fault with everything I did.
下手な職人は道具に小言を言う
A bad workman will quarrel with his tool.
上手な職人は道具に小言を言わぬ(能書筆を嫌わず)
“A cunning workman does not quarrel with his tool.”
彼は不景気だとかなんだとか始終小言を言っている
He is always grumbling at the badness of the times and what not.
朝から晩まで小言を言いづめだ
He is peevish―querulous.
女房は亭主に意気地が無いとかなんとかかとか小言を言いづめだ
She keeps nagging at him―dinning in his ears―as to what a good-for-nothing he is, and what not.
亭主は気の好い男で女房に小言なら一つ言ったことが無い
He is so good-natured that he never spoke severely to her.
小言を食う
to get a scolding―catch it
早く帰らないと小言を食うぞ
If you do not go home quickly, you will catch it.
将来はお小言を頂戴するようなことは致しません
You shall have no cause for complaint in future.

content:
こごとに〔戸毎に〕
〈副〉At every door; from door to door

content.content: 戸毎に遊説する
to canvass from door to door
彼女は巡礼に姿をやつして戸毎に物乞いして歩いた
She disguised herself as a pilgrim, and went begging from door to door.
戸毎に尋ねた
I inquired at every door.

ここのえ〔九重〕
〈名〉The Imperial Palace

ここのか〔九日〕
〈名〉Nine days:(何月九日)the 9th (of January, etc.)

content:
ここべつべつ〔個々別々〕
〈副〉Singly; singly and severally; each by itself

content.content: 一緒に行くとあやしまれるから個々別々に行こう
In order to disarm suspicion, we will go singly―each by himself.
花は個々別々にみるとさほど綺麗ではない
If you look at the blossoms singly and severally, you do not find them very pretty.

content:
こごむ〔跼む〕
〈自動〉To stoop (over one's pillow); to lean (over a book); to bend (over anything)

content.content: こごんで本を読む
to lean over a book
彼はこごんで歩く
He walks with a stoop.
病人の枕もとへこごんで様子を聞いた
I bent over his pillow, and asked after his health.
こごんで物を拾う
I stoop―lean forward―to pick up anything.

ここもと〔此許〕
〈代名詞〉I; we
〈副〉Here; now

content:
ここらあたり〔此処らあたり〕
〈副〉(Somewhere) about here; hereabouts

content.content: あの人の家はなんでもここらあたりだ
He lives somewhere about here.
その店はここらあたりのはずだ
The shop ought to be hereabouts.

content:
こころ〔心〕
〈名〉
1. (考える心)mind:(感ずる心)heart
《a》(心が)

content.content: あの人は心が善い
He has a good heart―He is good-hearted.
心が悪い
He has an evil heart―a black heart―He is evil-hearted―black-hearted.
心が大きい
He has a large mind―a large heart―He is large-minded―large-hearted―generous―magnanimous.
心が小さい
He has a small mined―a little heart―He is small-minded―little-hearted―ungenerous.
心が広い
He has a broad mind―He is broad-minded―liberal.
心が狭い
He has a narrow mind―He is narrow-minded―illiberal.
心が温かい
He has a warm heart―He is warm-hearted.
心が冷ややかだ
He has a cold heart―He is cold-hearted.
心が優しい
He has a tender heart―He is tender-hearted.
心が正しい、心が真直だ
He has a right heart―He is right-hearted―His heart is in the right place.
心が曲っている、心がねじけている
He has a crooked mind―a perverse heart―He is perverse-hearted―cross-grained―crabbed.
心が腐っている
He has a corrupt heart―He is corrupt-hearted.
心が練れている
He has a schooled mind―He is well schooled.
心がはずむ
to be spurred on
とんとん拍子に行ったので心がはずんだ
I was spurred on by easy successes―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Easy successes spurred me on.
あの人は心が置けない
You feel at home with him.
心が進む
to be willing―forward―eager
心が進まぬ
to be unwilling―backward―reluctant
彼は心が解けない
He does not relent towards me.

content: 《b》(心から)

content.content: 心から感謝致します
I thank you from my heart―thank you from the bottom of my heart―thank you cordially.
ご同情に対し心からの感謝を捧げます
I tender my cordial thanks for your sympathy.
ご同情を心からありがたいと思っております
I feel a heartfelt gratitude for your sympathy.

content: 《c》(心に)

content.content: 心に浮かぶ
to occur to one's mind―suggest itself to one's mind―come across one's mind―come into one's head―enter one's head
一趣向心に浮かんだ
An idea occurred to my mind―occurred to me―struck me.
煙を見ると火という念が心に浮かぶ
When I see smoke, the idea of fire occurs to my mind―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The sight of smoke suggests the idea of fire to my mind.
種々の考えが心に浮かんだ
Various thoughts passed through my mind.
心に懸かる
to weigh on one's mind
この借金が心にかかる
This debt weighs on my mind―It is a weight on my mind.
心にかなう
to be to one's mind―to one's taste―to one's liking―after one's fancy―after one's heart
この仕事が心にかなっている
The work is to my taste.
文章がちと心にかなわぬ
The style is not quite to my taste.
どうも心にかなった家が無い
I con not find a house after my fancy.
心に留める
(事実なら)to bear a fact in mind―keep a fact in mind―(人の忠告などなら)―lay one's advice to heart―(悪口などなら)―give heed to people's remarks
このことを心に留めて忘れるな
You must keep the fact in mind―bear the fact in mind.
僕の言うことを心に留めてよく考えてご覧
You must lay my advice to heart―“Put that in your pipe and smoke it.”
彼は人に悪口を言われても心にも留めない
He gives no heed to people's remarks.
心に銘する
to impress ［imprint, stamp, engrave, inscribe］ a fact on one's mind―into one's soul
このことを心に銘して忘れるな
You must have the fact impressed on your mind.
ご教訓は心に銘して忘れません
I shall have your precept engraved into my soul.
心に印する
to stamp a fact on one's mind―impress a fact on one's memory
心に問ふ
to ask oneself
善いか悪いか君の心に問うて見給え
I leave you to your conscience.
心に描く
to picture to oneself―figure to oneself―image to oneself
その名を聞いて立派な紳士を心に描いた
On hearing his name mentioned, I pictured to myself a fine gentleman.
心に徹する
to come home to one's heart
心にまかせぬことがある
Something has gone against me―gone wrong with me.
心に錠をおろす
to fortify one's mind―fortify oneself against temptation, etc.

content: 《d》(心にも)

content.content: 君は心にも無いことを言う
You express a sentiment foreign to your heart.
少しは僕の心にもなって見給え
You must put yourself in my place.

content: 《e》(心の)

content.content: あれは心の善い人だ
He has a good heart―He is good-hearted.
心の悪い奴だ
He has a bad heart―a black heart―He is bad-hearted―black-hearted.
心の大きい人だ
He has a large mind―a large heart―He is large-minded―large-hearted―generous―magnanimous.
心の小さい男だ
He has a small mind―a little heart―He is small-minded―little-hearted―ungenerous.
心の広い人だ
He has a broad mind―He is broad-minded―liberal.
心の狭い人だ
He has a narrow mind―He is narrow-minded―illiberal.
心の温かい人だ
He has a warm heart―He is warm-hearted.
心の冷ややかな人だ
He has a cold heart―He is cold-hearted.
心の優しい人だ
He has a tender heart―He is tender-hearted.
心の正しい人だ、心の真直な人だ
He has a right heart―He is right-hearted―His heart is in the right place.
心の曲った男だ、心のねじけた男だ
He has a crooked mind―a perverse heart―He is perverse-hearted―cross-grained―crabbed.
心の腐った奴だ
He had a corrupt heart―He is corrupt-hearted.
心の練れた人だ
He has a schooled mind―He is well schooled.
心のままに
as one pleases―at one's pleasure
去るも留るも心のままにし給え
You may go or stay at your pleasure.
心の底
one's inmost heart―motive
彼女は心の底では彼を崇拝している
She workships him in her inmost heart―in her heart of hearts.
心の底が見えすいている
His motive is apparent.
心の鬼
conscience
心の鬼が身を責める
My conscience pricks me―My conscience twinges me―My conscience smites me.
心の持ちよう
one's way of thinking
人の幸不幸は貧富の境遇よりも心の持ちよう
Happiness depends, not so much on one's circumstances, as on one's way of thinking.
人生は心の持ちよう(で地獄極楽)
Life is what you make it.
心の駒にむちうつ
to nerve one's heart―nerve oneself

content: 《f》(心は)

content.content: 心は持ちよう
Everything depends on one's way of thinking―“The mind can make a Heaven of Hell, a Hell of Heaven.”
彼は口は悪いが心は至って好い男
He has a foul tongue, but is, at heart,―at bottom,―a good fellow.
人の心は十人十色
So many men, so many minds―No two men are of a mind.
心は面の如し
You will as soon find two of a face as two of a mind.
彼の心は見えすいている
I can see through his heart.
心は二つ身は一つ
One can not be in two places at the same time.
身はまかしても心はまかせぬ
I am yours in body, but not in heart.
心はいやたけにはやれども力無き身の救うに由無し
Eager as I am, I am powerless to save him.

content: 《g》(心を)

content.content: 心を変える
to change one's mind
心を入れ替える
to amend (one's conduct)―mend one's ways―reform (oneself)―turn over a new leaf―lead a new life
心を休める
to set one's heart at ease―set one's mind at rest
心を打ち明ける
to open one's mind―open one's heart―unbosom oneself―to another
心を磨く
to improve one's mind―refine one's mind―educate one's mind
心を励ます
to take heart (of grace)
心を確かに持て
Keep a good heart!―Be of good heart!
心を鬼にする
to harden one's heart (against pity)―divest oneself of humanity
心を奪う
to engross one's mind―absorb one's attention
彼は遊びに心を奪われている
He is absorbed in pleasure.
専門に心を奪われている
He is engrossed in his profession.
心を静める
to calm oneself―compose oneself
心を落ち着ける
to collect oneself―gather one's scattered wits
心を焦がす
to sigh for somebody―languish for somebody
人に心を許す
to trust a man―confide in a man
知らぬ人に心を許すな
Do not trust a stranger―You must guard against strangers―You must take heed of strangers.
彼は決して人に心を許さぬ
He never trusts people.
子どもを七人産んでも女に心を許すな
Do not trust a woman even if she be the mother of seven children.
心を引き立てる
to cheer one up―rouse one up―stir one up
心を尽す
to devote oneself to anything
彼は職務に心を尽している
He is devoted to his duties.
心を尽して勉強する
to work with all one's heart and soul
彼女は心を尽して彼をもてなした
She was assiduous in her attentions to him.
学問に心を込める
to devote oneself to one's studies―concentrate one's mind on one's studies
学問に心を向ける
to bend one's mind to―direct one's attention to―one's studies
歌道に心を寄せる
to direct one's attention to poetry
上下心を一にして国を守る
High and low unite in defending the country.
心を合わして働く
They work with one accord.
心を置く
to be reserved
心を置かずに(心置き無く)お話しなさい
You may speak without reserve.
心を配る
to be vigilant―watchful―on the watch―on the lookout―on the alert
人の心をくむ、人の心を察する
to enter into one's feelings―enter into one's views
人の心を引く
to engage one's attention
人の心を引きつける
to be attractive―charming―alluring
人の心を動かす
to move one―affect one―touch one
彼は女の言葉に心を動かされた
He was moved by her words―affected by her words―touched by her words.
彼の言葉が深く僕の心を動かした
His words shook my very soul.
心を痛める
to distress oneself―trouble oneself―worry oneself―grieve―smart
試験に心を痛めている
I am worrying myself over the examination―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The examination worries me.
彼は失望して心を痛めている
He is smarting under disappointment.
そんなことをすると親の心を痛めるばかりだ
Such a step will only grieve your parents.
何事をするにも心を分かつな
Devote the whole man to anything―Be the whole man at anything.

content: 《h》(その他)

content.content: 眉目より心
A good heart is better than a fair face.
今度はどうかと心ひそかに心配しておった
I was anxious in my heart how it would be this time.
心ひそかに悦んだ
I felt a secret joy.
心ひそかに憂えた
I grieved in secret―groaned in spirit.
心ここにあらざれば見れども見えず
If the mind is absent, the eye is blind.
気は心
Sentiment is everything―Heart is heart after all―One must obey the dictates of one's heart.
気は心だから金を返しておく
I will repay you the money to ease my heart.
気は心だから一円もやっておこう
I'll give him something for conscience' sake.
君の心次第
It rests with you to decide―The decision rest with you.
僕の言うことを心して聞け
Mind what I say!
為すべきことを心してせよ
Mind what you are about.

content: 2. (=何心)a turn of mind; a temperament

content.content: あの人は歌心がある
He is of a poetical turn of mind.
芝居心がある
He is of a dramatic turn of mind.
絵心
an artistic temperament―a turn for drawing
この子は絵心がある
The child has a turn for drawing.

content: 3. (=意、意志)will; pleasure

content.content: 鉄石の心
an iron will―an adamantine will
心のままに
at one's pleasure―as one pleases
去るも留まるも心のままにし給え
You may go or stay at your pleasure.

content: 4. (=意向)intention

content.content: 僕は軍人になる心だ
I intend to be a soldier―I mean to be a soldier―I am going to be a soldier.

content: 5. (=注意)attention

content.content: 人の心を引く
to engage one's attention
学問に心を向ける
to direct one's attention to one's studies
歌心に心を寄せる
to direct one's attention to poetry

content: 6. (=思慮)thought

content.content: 心ある人
a thoughtful man
心ある人はそんなことはせぬ
No thoughtful person would do such a thing.

content: 7. (=意味)meaning; signification

content.content: 僕の心がわかったかね
Do you understand what I mean?
彼女は心ありげな目つきで僕を見た
She gave me a significant look.

content: 8. (=謎の心)the why (of the solution of a puzzle)

こころあたり〔心当り〕
〈名〉Occurring to mind; having in mind

content.content: そう言われるとなるほど心当たりがある
Now that you say so, something occurs to my mind.
誰か適任者の心当たりは無いか
Can't you think of any one fit for the post?―Have you any fit person in mind?
心当たりはありませんね
I can't think of any one―I have no one in mind.
心当たりの人がある
I have a person in mind―I have a person in my eyes.
誰がこんなことをしたか君は心当たりは無いか
can't you think who can have done such a thing?
彼がいそうだと思う心当たりのところは皆立ち寄ってみた
I called at every likely place.
君が尋ねる人の詳しい話をしたら心当たりがあるかも知れぬ
It you will describe the person you want, I may be able to identify him.
遺失品心当たりの者は三日以内に申し出るべし
The loser of the article must claim it within three days.

content:
こころあて〔心当て〕
〈名〉
1. (=臆測)guess; conjecture:(=に) at random; at hazard, at haphazard

content.content: 僕の心当て通りだ
I was right in my conjectures.
心当てに選んだのだ
I chose at random.

content: 2. (=心頼み)hope; expectation; reliance

content.content: 君が来るだろうと心当てに待っていた
I waited in expectation of your coming―waited in reliance on your coming―counted upon your coming.
褒美を心当てにしたことだ
He did it in hopes of getting a reward.
心当てがはずれた
I am disappointed of my expectations.

content:
こころありげ〔心あり気〕
〈形〉(=な) meaning; significant:(=に) significantly

content.content: 彼女は心あり気に僕の顔を見た
She gave me a significant look.

こころいき〔心意気〕
〈名〉
1. (=心立て)heart; temper; disposition
2. (=人を思う情)one's sentiment (towards another)

こころいれ〔心入れ〕
〈名〉Care; attention

こころうつり〔心移り〕
〈名〉Change of mind; fickleness; inconstancy:(反逆心の意味なら)to turn traitor to one's party

content:
こころえ〔心得〕
〈名〉
1. (=知識、理解)Knowledge; understanding:(=る) to know; to understand:(何を何と心得る)to regard... as...; to take... for...

content.content: 彼は多少英語を心得ている
He knows something of English―He has some knowledge of English.
彼は商売を心得ている
He understands his business.
万事心得ている
He understands his business―He knows what he is about.
彼はちゃんと心得ているから大丈夫(はたで心配は無用)
Depend upon it, he knows what he is about.
僕は万事心得ているからまかしておけ(細工は流々仕上げをご覧じろ)
Leave the matter to me, for I know what I am about.
貴様は俺を何と心得ておるか
What do you take me for?
君達は学校を遊ぶところと心得ているか
Do you regard the school as a place for playing?
委細心得ました
Very well, sir.
よし心得た
Very good.

content: 2. (=規則、指図)rules; directions; instructions

content.content: 授業心得
rules for teaching
参観人心得
directions to visitors
職務心得
office instructions

content: 〈後置形容詞〉(=代理)acting

content.content: 校長心得
an acting principal

content:
こころえがお〔心得顔〕
〈名〉A knowing look

content.content: 女将は心得顔で出て行った
The landlady left the room with a knowing look.

content:
こころえちがい〔心得違い〕
〈名〉
1. (=誤解)mistake; misunderstanding; misapprehension

content.content: 心得違いをする
to misunderstand―misapprehend―be mistaken
そりゃ君の心得違いだ
You are mistaken.
妙な心得違いをしている
You labour under a strange mistake.

content: 2. (=不心得)wrong-doing; a misdemeanour; an imprudence; an indiscretion

content.content: 心得違いをする
to do wrong―misdemean oneself―forget oneself―commit an imprudence―commit an indiscretion
心得違いを致しました
I have done wrong―(失錯なら)―committed an imprudence―(男女関係なら)―committed an indiscretion.
彼女の心得違いを責めた
I reproved her for her indiscretion.
(娘が言う)そんな心得違いをする私じゃありません
I do not commit such an indiscretion.
心得違いの無いように戒めた
I warned him against doing wrong.
お前達は心得違いをしているぞ
You are misguided men.

content:
こころおきなく〔心置き無く〕
〈副〉Unreservedly; without reserve; free from care; freely

content.content: 言うことがあるなら心おきなく言い給え
You may speak without reserve.
誰もいないから心おきなくお話しなさい
Now that we are alone, you may,talk freely.
彼は後事を僕に託して心おきなく出陣した
Leaving his affairs in my hands, he proceeded to the front free from care.
心おきなく頂戴致しました
I have enjoyed myself freely.
お心おきなくご滞在下さい
You have welcome home with us.

content:
こころおぼえ〔心覚え〕
〈名〉Remembrance; recollection

content.content: その人に逢った心覚えがあるか
Do you remember meeting him?
心覚えがない
I have no recollection of it.

content:
こころがかり〔心懸り〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: きがかり〔気懸り〕

content:
こころがけ〔心掛け〕
〈名〉
1. Mindfulness:(=る) to be mindful of (anything); to keep (anything) in mind; to bear (anything) in mind

content.content: これは学生の心がくべきことだ
The student should keep the fact in mind―bear the fact in mind.
このことは常に忘れぬように心がくべし
You should bear this fact in mind―have this fact impressed on your mind.
(教員が一人欲しいが)お心当たりが無けりゃ心がけておいて下さい
If you can't think of any one, you will please keep it in mind.
心がけておいてあったらお知らせしましょう
I will bear you in mind, and if I hear of one I will let you know.
あれは心がけの好い人だ
He is mindful of everything.
それは平常の心がけが悪いからのことだ
That comes of your unmindfulness.
私は勤めを怠らぬように平生心がけております
I am ever mindful of my duty.
平素の心がけが大切だ
One should be ever mindful of one's duty.
感心な心がけだ
Your mindfulness does you credit.

content: 2. (=財政上の心がけ)providence:(=る) to provide for (the future); to provide oneself with (money, etc.)

content.content: あれは心がけの好い人だ
He is a provident man.
心がけの悪い人だ
He is an improvident man.
君が貧乏をするのは平生の心がけが悪いからだ
Your poverty comes of your improvidence.
金持ちになるのも貧乏するのも心がけ一つだ
Wealth or poverty will depend on your providence.
若いうちに老後の心がけをすべきものだ
Youth should provide for age.
今日は金を心がけて参りません
I have not provided myself with any money today.

content: 3. (=精神態度)mental attitude

content.content: その心がけで押し通すが好い
You ought to persevere in that attitude of mind.

content:
こころがまえ〔心構え〕
〈名〉Expectation; preparation; readiness

content.content: こんなことがあろうと心がまえをしておった
I was prepared for this.
こんなことがあろうとは心がまえが無かった
I was not prepared for this.

content:
こころがら〔心柄〕
〈名〉Heart; temper; disposition

content.content: あれは心柄の好い男だ
He has a good heart―He is a good-hearted man―His heart is in the right place.

content:
こころがわり〔心変り〕
〈名〉Change of mind; fickleness; inconstancy; treachery:(=する) to change one's mind:(謀叛するの意味なら)to turn traitor to one's cause:(形容詞に用いれば)fickle; inconstant; treacherous

content.content: よく心変わりする人だ
He is very fickle―a fickle-hearted man.
彼は心変わりして敵方についてしまった
He turned traitor to his party, and went over to the enemy.
お心変わりの無いうちに頂戴しておきましょう
I will trouble you for it before you change your mind.

こころくばり〔心配り〕
〈名〉Anxiety; solicitude

content:
こころぐみ〔心組〕
〈名〉Intention

content.content: 来月上京の心組みです
It is my intention―I intend―to go to town next month.

content:
こころぐるしい〔心苦しい〕
〈叙述形容詞〉To be painful (to one); to go against one's conscience

content.content: 君の厄介になるのは心苦しい
It goes against my conscience to impose upon your hospitality.
君に迷惑をかけては心苦しい
It would be painful to me to put you to inconvenience.

content:
こころざし〔志〕
〈名〉
1. (=意志)Will

content.content: 志あれば事ついに成る
“When there is a will, there is a way”―“Nothing is impossible to the man who can will.”
金石の志
an iron will―an adamantine will
お志でたくさんです
I will take the will for the deed.

content: 2. (=動機)motive

content.content: その志は賞すべくその行為は笑うべし
His motive is worthy of praise, but his deed deserves censure.

content: 3. (=意向、目的、志望)intention; resolution; purpose; object; aim; ambition; aspiration; wish

content.content: 私は軍人になる志です
I intend to be a soldier―I am going to be a soldier―I aspire to military honours―I am an aspirant to military honours.
商人になる志です
I intend to be a merchant―(こっけいに言えば)―I am an aspirant to commercial honours.
彼は志が堅い
He has a film purpose.
志が弱い
He is infirm of purpose.
志を懐く
to cherish an ambition―aspire after greatness
志を立てる
to form a purpose―form a resolution―propose an object to oneself―set an object before one
男子立志
A student lad with high resolve,
出郷関
He bids thee, home, adieu!
学若不成
Unless his heart's desire be his,
死不還
He lives not thee to view.
志を遂げる、志を得る
to accomplish one's purpose―effect one's purpose―attain one's object―realize one's wishes
僕は万難を排して志を遂げる決心だ
I will accomplish my purpose at any cost―Nothing shall hinder me from accomplishing my purpose.
彼は立派に志を遂げた
He has attained the object of his ambition.
彼は志を得ずしてむなしく死んだ
He died before he could realize his wishes.
親の志を継ぐ
to follow in one's father's footsteps―walk in one's father's shoes
志を失う
to ruin oneself―be ruined
彼は志が大きい
He has a great ambition.
なんぞその志の小なる
What a petty ambition!
志は大なるべく心は小なるべし
Aim high, but lie low.
燕雀何んぞ鴻鵠の志を知らんや
How can the sparrow soar with the eagle?
天下万民を安んずるはこれ英雄の志
To enable the millions to live in peace―that is the great man's aim.
匹夫も志を奪うべからず
Even a churl, armed with resolution, will effect his purpose.

content: 4. (=親切)kindness; kind intentions; a kind offer

content.content: お志はありがとう
I thank you for your kind intentions.
せっかくのお志だから頂戴します
Since you are so kind,―Since you are so pressing,―I shall accept it.
せっかくのお志ですがお断り致します
I am sorry I must decline your kind offer―I am sorry I can not avail myself of your kindness.
人の志を無にする
not to avail oneself of another's kindness
人の志を無にするものではない
You should avail oneself of another's kindness.
お志はありがたいがお心底が恐ろしい
I am thankful for his kindness, but he must have some end in view.

content: 5. (=贈物)a present; a gift

こころざす〔志す〕
〈他動〉
1. To intend (to do something); to purpose (to do or doing something); to aim at (anything); to aspire to (honours); to set one's heart on (anything)

content.content: 立身を志す
to aim at advancement in life
学に志す
to set one's heart on learning
幼にして学に志す
He resolved to study―resolved to make himself a scholar―at an early age.
彼は軍人を志している
He intends to be a soldier―He aspires to military honours―He is an aspirant to military honours.
彼は最初大学に入ることを志した
His original intention was to enter the University.
彼は中学を卒えて東京へ志した
When he finished his middle school, he started for Tokyo―set out for the capital.

content:
こごろし〔子殺し〕
〈名〉(事)infanticide:(人)an infanticide

content.content: 子殺しをする
to commit infanticide

content:
こころする〔心する〕
〈自動〉To mind

content.content: 僕の言うことを心して聞け
Mind what I say!
為すべきことを心してせよ
Mind what you are about!

content:
こころぞえ〔心添え〕
〈名〉Advice; counsel; suggestion:(=する) to advise; to counsel; to suggest (anything to one)

content.content: 授業上についてなにかお心添えはありませんか
Have you anything to go suggest to me about teaching?

content:
こころだて〔心立て〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: きだて〔気立て〕

content:
こころだのみ〔心頼み〕
〈名〉Hope; expectation; reliance

content.content: 心頼みにする
to hope for―expect―rely upon―count upon―set one's hopes on―anything
君の約束を心頼みに待っていた
I have been waiting in reliance on your promise.
君の来るのを心頼みに待った
I waited in expectation of your coming―waited in reliance on your coming―counted upon your coming.
君の助力を心頼みにしている
I count upon your support.
寡婦は息子の卒業を心頼みにしている
The widow has set her hopes on her son's graduation.

こころづかい〔心遣い〕
〈名〉Care; anxiety; solicitude

content:
こころづく〔心付く〕
〈他動〉
1. (=気がつく)to notice; to perceive; to remark; to become aware of (anything)

content.content: 僕は彼のいることを心づかなかった
I did not notice his presence.
人込みで彼に心づかなかった
I did not perceive him in the crowd.
汽車に乗り違えて一時間経って漸く間違いに気づいた
I took the wrong train by mistake, and it was an hour before I become aware of my mistake.

content: 2. (=胸に浮かぶ)to think of (anything); to occur to one's mind

content.content: そりゃ旨い趣向だ、僕にはとんと心づかなかった
An excellent idea! I never thought of it―It never occurred to me.
もっと早く心づけば良かった
I wish I had thought of it before.

content:
こころづくし〔心尽し〕
〈名〉Kindness; attentions; assiduities; a sign of good-will

content.content: 彼らは珍客に対して心尽しのもてなしをした
They were assiduous in their attentions to their honoured guest.
これを最後の心尽しとしよう
This shall be my last sign of good-will.

content:
こころづけ〔心付け〕
〈名〉
1. (=人に注意を与えること)suggestion:(=る) to suggest (a plan to one); to remind (one of anything)

content.content: 彼に干渉しない方がよかろうと心づけた
I suggested to him the propriety of non-interference.
彼が約束を忘れないように心づけておこう
I will remind him of him promise.

content: 2. (=目下の者にやる祝儀)a tip; a gratuity; a consideration; a perquisite

content.content: 女中に心付けをする
to tip―consider―remember―the waitress
召使いに心付けをしなけりゃならぬ
We must consider thee servants.
給仕にお心付けを願います
Please remember the waiter.

content:
こころづよい〔心強い〕
〈形〉
1. (=気強い)(主観的に言えば)confident; secure; reassured:(客観的に言えば)reassuring; cheering; encouraging

content.content: 君が一緒なら心強い
Your company will inspire me with confidence―keep me in countenance.
そう思うと心強い
I am reassured by the thought―It is reassuring to think so.

content: 2. (=無情、つれない)hard-hearted; unfeeling; cruel

こころどけ〔心解け〕
〈名〉Reconciliation; relenting

content.content: 二人は心解けがしたようだ
They seem to be reconciled (to each other).
彼は僕に対してなかなか心解けがしない
He will not relent towards me.

content:
こころならずも〔心ならずも〕
〈副〉Against one's will; against one's better judgement

content.content: もうそうすりゃ心ならずも訴えなけりゃならない
Than I shall be obliged to proceed against you, though much against my will.
心ならずも勧められるままにそうした
I suffered myself to be persuaded against my better judgement.

こころにくい〔心憎い〕
〈形〉
1. (=憎むべき)Hateful
2. (=覚束ない)doubtful
3. (=奥床しい)mysterious; interesting

content:
こころね〔心根〕
〈名〉One's inmost feelings; motive

content.content: 心根を察する
to enter into one's feelings―penetrate into one's motive

content:
こころのこま〔心の駒〕
〈名〉Uncontrollable passions

content.content: 心の駒にむちうつ
(原意は)to control one's passions―(普通の意味は)―nerve one's heart―nerve oneself

content:
こころのそこ〔心の底〕
〈名〉The bottom of one's heart; the depths of one's heart; one's inmost heart; one's heart of hearts; one's motive

content.content: 心の底が見えすいている
His motive is apparent.
心の底からありがたく思う
I feel grateful from the bottom of my heart.
心の底から出る言葉だ
Those words come out of the depths of his heart.
彼女は心の底では彼を崇拝している
She worships him in her inmost heart―in her heart of hearts.

content:
こころのたけ〔心の丈〕
〈名〉All one thinks and feels

content.content: 会って心のたけを話したい
I should like to see him and tell him all I think and feel.

content:
こころのままに〔心の儘に〕
〈副〉As one pleases; at one's pleasure

content.content: 去るも留まるも心のままにし給え
You may go or stay at your pleasure―at your sweet pleasure.

content:
こころばえ〔心ばえ〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: こころばせ〔心ばせ〕

content:
こころばかり〔心計り〕
〈名〉A mere form; a mere token

content.content: 心ばかりの贈物
a mere token of one's goodwill
ほんの心ばかりですがお礼の印しまでに
I beg you will accept a mere token of my gratitude.
心ばかりのご馳走です
It is an entertainment only meant to show my good will.
心ばかりの法会をそこそこにすました
A mere from of religious service was hurried through.

content:
こころばせ〔心ばせ〕
〈名〉(Disposition of) heart

content.content: 心ばせの好い人だ
He is a good-hearted man―His heart is in the right place.
心ばせの悪い男だ
He is evil-hearted―black-hearted.

content:
こころひそかに〔心密かに〕
〈副〉In one's heart; inwardly; secretly

content.content: 今度はどうかと心ひそかに心配しておった
I was anxious in my heart how it would be this time.
心ひそかに悦んだ
I felt a secret joy.
心ひそかに憂えた
I grieved inwardly―groaned in spirit.

content:
こころぼそい〔心細い〕
〈形〉Slender (hopes); little (hope); hopeless (prospects); lonely (condition); forlorn (feeling); wretched (feeling):(叙述形容詞に用いれば)to feel lonely; to feel forlorn; to feel wretched; to despair; to lose heart; to feel like crying

content.content: 心細くて泣きたくなる
I feel like crying.
友人に死なれて心細い
The death of my friend makes me feel lonely.
思い出すと心細くなる
I feel forlorn―feel wretched―when I think of it.
彼は全快の見込みがよしあるとしても心細いものだ
There is little, if any, hope of his recovery―There are slender hopes of his recovery.
心細い形勢だ
The prospects are hopeless.
そんな心細いことを言うものじゃない
You should not despair―“Let us hope for the best!”―“Never say die!”
この困難を見てはちと心細くなる
I almost despair―I nearly lose heart―at the sight of these difficulties.
最後の手段が失敗した時は内心心細かった
When the last resource failed, I despaired in my heart.
東京で金が無いと心細い
Want of money in Tokyo,makes one feel forlorn.
小遣がたった一円しか残っていないと思うと心細かった
I felt like crying when I thought I had only one yen left.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 僕を知らないって、心細いね
Not know me!
僕の顔を覚えていないって、心細いね
Not remember me!
あれほど説明したのに聞かないって、心細いね
Not hear my explanation!

content:
こころまかせ〔心任せ〕
〈名〉One's pleasure

content.content: 心まかせに
as one pleases―at one's pleasure
去るも留まるも君の心まかせにし給え
You may go or stay at your pleasure―at your sweet pleasure.
どうともお心まかせになさい
Do as you please!―Please yourself!
娘の心まかせにしましょう
I will let her do as she pleases―let her have her own way.
この金はどうしょうと君の心まかせに使い給え
The money is at your disposal―entirely at your disposal.
心まかせに歩くのは愉快だ
It is pleasant to go whenever fancy leads.
この身は殺すとも生かすともあなたの心まかせだ
I am at your mercy―I am wholly in your power―you may kill or spare me.

content:
こころまち〔心待ち〕
〈名〉Expectation

content.content: 今日あたりは君が来るだろうと心待ちに待っておった
I have been expecting―waiting in expectation of―your coming.
けんかが始まった時誰か仲裁するだろうと心待ちに待っていた
When the quarrel began, I was counting upon somebody's intervention.

content:
こころみ〔試み〕
〈名〉
1. (=ためし)a trial; a test; an attempt; an essay:(冒険的なら)a venture:(=る) to try, make a trial; to test, put to the test; to attempt, make an attempt; to essay, make an essay; to venture

content.content: 君は試みる気があるか
Do you feel like trying?―feel inclined to make a trial?
試みに彼を使ってみよう
I will employ him for trial―by way of experiment.
私を試みて下さい
Give me a trial!―give me a fair chance!
(不可能と知りつつ)試みるのは無謀だ
It is madness to make the attempt.
これは試みに作ってみた英作文です
This is my first attempt at English composition.
試みは効を奏さなかった
The attempt was ineffectual―The attempt was fruitless of results―The attempt was attended with no results.
彼の勇気を試みてやったのだ
I put his courage to the test.
その立論に対して攻撃を試みん
I will venture an attack on your position.
試みに大海に乗り出す
to venture on the sea

content: 2. (=誘惑)temptation

content.content: 吾らを試みに遭わし給うなかれ
“Lead us not into temptation.”
試みに勝つ
to resist a temptation
試みに負ける
to yield temptation

content:
こころもち〔心持〕
〈名〉Feeling

content.content: 心持が好い
I feel well―feel comfortable―feel pleasant.
一杯飲むと心持が好い
A glass of wine makes one feel pleasant.
人を助けると心持が好い
One feels well when one has helped a man.
湯に入ると心持が好い
I feel refreshed after a bath―A bath is refreshing.
新しい家へ入って心持が好い
I feel comfortable in my new house.
これは心持の好い家だ
This is a comfortable house (to live in).
心持の好い座敷だ
It is a comfortable room―a sung room―a cosy room.
心持の好い天気だ
It is pleasant weather―agreeable weather.
旅行に行って来て心持が好い
I feel the better for my journey.
心持が悪い
I feel ill―feel badly―feel uncomfortable.
今日は心持の好くない日だ
I feel out of sorts today.
人を害すると心持が悪い
One feels badly when one has injured a man.
食った魚がフグだと聞いて心持が悪かった
I had an unpleasant feeling when I heard that the fish I had eaten was poisonous.
これは心持の悪い家だ
This is an uncomfortable house.
心持の悪い天気だ
It is unpleasant weather―disagreeable weather―beastly weather.
心持を悪くする
(自分のなら)to feel hurt―(人のなら)―hurt one's feelings.
彼は僕にあんなことを言われて心持を悪くしなけりゃいいが
I hope my remark has not hurt his feelings.
そんなことを言われりゃ心持を悪くする
I should feel hurt to have such Things said of me.
彼は心持を悪くして帰ったろう
He must have gone away hurt.
心持が悪くなる
to feel sick
血を見ると心持が悪くなる
The sight of blood makes me feel sick.
誰だって賞められて悪い心持はしない
Nobody feels displeased at being praised.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: (病人に向かって)今日はお心持はどうですか
How do you find yourself this morning?
僕の心持になって見給え
Put yourself in my place!
そういう目に逢った心持を察し給え
Imagine the effect of such an experience.

content: 〈副〉(=少し)a thought; an idea; a little; a trifle:(色なら)a shade

content.content: 心持大きい
It is a thought larger.

content:
こころもとない〔心許無い〕
〈叙述形容詞〉To have misgivings; one's mind (or heart) misgiving one

content.content: この事業の成功が心もとない(心もとなく思う)
I have misgivings about―My mind misgives me about―the success of the enterprise.

こころやさしい〔心優しい〕
〈形〉Tender-hearted

content:
こころやすい〔心安い〕
〈形〉
1. (=親密な)intimate; familiar

content.content: 彼とは心安くしている
I am on intimate terms with him.
二人は心安くしている
They are on familiar terms with each other.
たいそう心安くしている
They are great friends with each other.
人と心安くなる
to grow intimate with―make friends with―a person
知らない人とあまり心安くするな(人の名を呼び捨てなどにするな)
Don't be too familiar with strangers.
この後お心安く願います
I beg you will favour me with your friendship―(はあまり固苦しい、普通は)―I should like to know you better―I hope you will know me better.

content: 2. (=容易な)easy

content.content: 心安いご用です
It is no trouble at all.

content:
3. 
〈叙述形容詞〉(=安心する)to feel easy

content.content: お心安くおぼしめせ
You may make yourself easy―set your heart at ease.

content:
こころやすだて〔心安立て〕
〈名〉Overfamiliarity

content.content: あまり心安立てするからついけんかするのだ
You are too familiar with each other, and that's why you quarrel.
人と心安立てするな(人の名を呼び捨てなどにするな)
Don't be too familiar with people.
お心安立てについこんなことまで申上げました
I have made all these confidences to you out of familiarity.

content:
こころやすめ〔心安め〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: きやすめ〔気休め〕

content:
こころやり〔心遣り〕
〈名〉
1. (=気晴し)diversion; recreation; relaxation
2. (=慰め)consolation

content.content: 故郷へ帰って死んだのがせめてもの心やりだ
He lived to see his native land, and that's one consolation.

content.content: 小癪な娘
a saucy girl―a pert miss
小癪な娘だ
She has an old head on young shoulders.
僕は小癪な子は嫌いだ
I don't like old heads on young shoulders.
なにを小癪な

content:
こしゅ〔固守〕
〈名〉Adhesion; persistence; tenacity:(=する) to adhere to (one's resolution); to stick to (one thing); to keep to (old customs); to hold fast to (one's opinion); to cling to (life); to persist in (error); to persevere in (a course); to be tenacious of (one's rights, etc.)

content.content: 僕はどこまでも決心を固守する(決して決心を翻さぬ)
I will adhere to my resolution.
計画を固守する
to adhere to a plan
田舎では旧習を固守している
Country people keep to old customs.
自説を固守する
to hold fast to one's opinion
彼は頑固に自説を固守している
He is wedded to his opinion.
僕は是が非でも自説を固守するというわけではない
I do not persist in error―I am open to conviction.
方針を固守する
to persevere in a course
英国人は権利を固守する
The Englishman is tenacious of his rights.

content:

content.content: 保証人は戸主たることを要す
The surety must be a householder.
願書は戸主の連印を要す
The application most have the joint signature of the head of the family.

content.content: 彼は殿下に扈従して世界を漫遊した
He made a tour round the world in His Highness's suite―in attendance on His Highness.

content:
ごじゅう〔五十〕
〈名、形〉Fifty

content.content: 五十五
fifty-five
第五十
the fiftieth
五十番
No.50(number fifty)
五十倍
fifty times
あの人は五十台だ
He is in his fifties.
五十台の人
a man in his fifties―a quinquagenarian
五十の坂を越している
He is past fifty―gone fifty―turned of fifty―on the wrong side of fifty―on the shady side of fifty.
人生五十
“Three score and ten is the age of man.”

content.content: 小姑は鬼子千疋
A sister-in-law torments like a thousand devils.

〈名〉A five-storied pagoda

〈名〉Old books; gray record

〈名〉The Imperial palace

content:
こしょう〔故障〕
〈名〉
1. (=障碍)an obstacle; a hindrance; an obstruction; an impediment; a hitch; a disability

content.content: どこかに故障がある
There is a hitch somewhere.
いろいろ故障があって成功はむつかしい
There are many obstacles in the way of success.
その女は身に故障はないか
Has she no physical disability?―Is there nothing to hinder her marriage?
身に故障無し
She is all right―There is nothing wrong with her.
故障無く
without a hitch―without let or hindrance―smoothly―swimmingly
事が故障無く運んだ
The matter proceeded without a hitch.
話が故障無くすんだ
The negotiations ended without let or hindrance.
君が加盟さえすれば事が故障無く進む
If you will only join the concern, it will proceed smoothly―go on swimmingly―go on wheels.
故障が無ければ月曜に発ちます
I leave on Monday, if nothing intervenes.

content: 2. (=変事)an accident; a trouble; a break-down; the matter; something wrong; not all right

content.content: なにか故障がある
There is something wrong―All is not right.
どこかに故障がある
There is something wrong somewhere―a screw loose somewhere.
機関に故障あり
There is engine trouble―The engine has broken down―Something is wrong with the engine―Something is the matter with the engine.
故障はなにか
What is the matter?―what is the trouble?
汽車に故障があった
There was an accident to the train.
途中で故障があったため汽車が延着した
Owing to an accident on the way, the train is behind time.
(汽車が止まった)なにか故障があるのか
Is anything wrong?―Is there a break-down?
電話に故障がある
The telephone is out of order―under repairs.
身に故障絶えず
He is always in some trouble or other―(身体なら)―He is never quite well.
電車に故障を生じた
The car is disabled.
故障車
a disabled car
故障付船荷証書
a foul bill of loading
故障付受取書
a foul receipt
故障付船積指図書
a foul shipping order

content: 3. (=異議)a protest; an objection; a demurrer; a veto

content.content: (縁談などに)故障を入れる
to make objections to―raise an objection to―interpose an objection to―interpose one's veto on―a match
処置に対して故障を申立てる
to protest against―demur to―a measure
役人はいつもながらなにかしらめんどうくさい故障を言う
Official persons are always making difficulties.

content:

〈名〉Pepper

content.content: 胡椒で料理を調味する
to pepper a dish
肉などに胡椒を振りかける
to sprinkle pepper on meat―sprinkle meat with pepper
(食卓上の)胡椒入れ
a papper-box―a pepper-castor

content.content: 孤城落日
a solitary and helpless state
彼は孤城落日の観ありだ
He is solitary and helpless.

content:
ごしょう〔後生〕
〈名〉Future life

content.content: 後生を願う
to pray for future life―pray for future happiness
(これをするのも)後生のためだ
I do this for my spiritual interest―for my spiritual welfare.
後生一生のお願いだ
I adjure you by God―I conjure you by Heaven.
後生のお願いだ、後生だから
For God's sake―For Heaven's sake.
後生だから取返しのつかぬことをしてくれ給うな
For Heaven's sake, don't take the fatal step!
後生だから助けてやって下さい
For mercy's sake, spare the poor fellow!
後生大事とすがった
I clung for dear life.

content.content: ありがたき御錠をこうむるは拙者の面目

content.content: 後生大事と命令を守っている

content:
こじょうらくじつ〔孤城落日〕
〈名〉A solitary and helpless condition

content.content: 彼は孤城落日の観有りだ
He is solitary and helpless.

content:
こしょく〔古色〕
〈名〉An antique look; a note of antiquity:(銅器などのは)patina

content.content: 古色を帯びている
to have an antique look―have a note of antiquity
奈良は古色を帯びた都会である
Nara is a quaint-looking city.
銅器は古色蒼然たり
The bronze utensils look hoary with patina.

content:
ごしょく〔誤植〕
〈名〉A misprint; a typographical error:(=する) to misprint

content.content: この本は誤植だらけだ
The book is full of misprints.
日本で出来る英書で誤植の無いのは少ない
Few English books made in Japan are free from misprints.

〈名〉A court car

content:
こじらいれき〔故事来歴〕
〈名〉Origin and history; a tale

content.content: 言葉の故事来歴を探る
to inquire into the origin and history of a phrase
これには故事来歴がある
And thereby hangs a tale.
英語は故事来歴の多い国語である
The English language is rich with the spoils of time.

content:
こしらえ〔拵え〕
〈名〉(洋服などのこしらえ)make:(支度のこしらえ)get-up:(役者の顔のこしらえ)make-up:(刀剣のこしらえ)a mounting

content.content: この上衣のこしらえが気に入らぬ
I don't like the make of the coat.
この刀はこしらえが好い
The sword has a good mounting―The sword is well-mounted.
あの女は上品なこしらえだ
She is elegantly got up.
こしらえが若過ぎる
She gets herself up too young.
あの役者はこしらえが上手だ
He is good at making up his face.

こしらえがお〔拵え顔〕
〈名〉An affected look; a grimace:(役者なら)a made-up face

content:
こしらえかた〔拵え方〕
〈名〉How to make, the way to (anything)

content.content: 料理のこしらえ方
the recipe for a dish―the receipt for a dish

content:
こしらえごと〔拵え事〕
〈名〉
1. (=こしらえ話)a fabrication; a fiction; an invention
2. (=窮策)a device; an artifice; a shift
3. (=狂言)a got-up affair; a put-up job

content.content: あのけんかは相当のこしらえごとだ
The quarrel was a got-up affair.

こしらえなおす〔拵え直す〕
〈他動〉To make over (a coat, etc.)

content:
こしらえばなし〔拵え話〕
〈名〉A made-up story; a trumped-up story; a cock-and-bull story; a fabrication; a fiction; an invention

content.content: こしらえ話をする
to make up a story (out of the whole cloth)―trump up a story―invent a story―fabricate a lie―forge a lie
これは彼のこしらえ話に違いない
It must be a fiction of his―a pure fabrication of his.

こしらえもの〔拵え物〕
〈名〉A counterfeit; a sham; a fake

content:
こしらえる〔拵える〕
〈他動〉
1. To make (shoes); to build (a house)

content.content: 靴は革でこしらえる
They make shoes out of leather―Shoes are made of leather.
日本人は紙でいろいろな物をこしらえる
The Japanese make many things out of paper―make paper into many things.
パンは何でこしらえるか、麦粉でこしらえる
What is bread made from?―Bread is made from flour.
ビールは何でこしらえるか、大麦でこしらえる
What is beer made from?―Beer is brewed from barley.
家は何でこしらえるか、木や石や煉瓦でこしらえる
What are houses built of?―Houses are built of wood, stone or brick.
庭をこしらえる
to lay out a garden
弁当をこしらえる
to pack a lunch-basket
役者が顔をこしらえる
An actor makes up his face.
洋服をこしらえて下さい
Please make me a suit of clothes.
靴もこしらえて上げよう
I will make you a pair of shoes.
なにかうまいものをこしらえて上げよう
I will get you something nice.
この品は手でこしらえるから高価なのです
These goods are expensive, for they are made by hand.
機械でこしらえるともっと安くできます
They can be more cheaply made by machinery.
この靴は誂えてこしらえさしたのだ
These shoes are made to order.
寸法に合わしてこしらえたのだ
They are made to measure.
上衣はこれを手本にしてこしらえてくれ
Make my coat on this model―after this pattern.
この上衣はこしらえ直させなけりゃならぬ
My coat must be made over.
上衣はいつまでにこしらえてくれますか
How soon can have my coat ready?
明後日までにこしらえておきます
I shall have it ready―It shall be ready―by the day after tomorrow.
身なりをこしらえる
to get oneself up
松をこしらえる
to trim a pine
腹をこしらえる
to satisfy one's appetite―refresh one's inner man
子どもをこしらえる
to strike off a child―knock off a child
女が男をこしらえる
A girl takes up with a man―forms a connection with a man.
あの女は男を幾人もこしらえている
She has many lovers.
男が女をこしらえる
A man takes up with a girl―forms a connection with a woman.
あの男はよく女をこしらえる
He plays havoc among the girls.
金をこしらえる
(儲けるの意味なら)to make money―(金策するの意味なら)―raise money
地所を抵当にしてこしらえた金だ
I have raised the money on my estate.
彼は山を当てて身代をこしらえた
He has made a hit in speculation, and made a fortune.
あれはあやしい儲けでこしらえた身代だ
He has built up his fortune by questionable means.
百円ばかりぜひこしらえなければならなぬ
I need some hundred yen badly.

content: 8. (=見つける)to find; to look out

content.content: 働き口をこしらえなければならない
I must find a place―secure a situation―look out a job.

content: 9. (=こしらえ事をする)to fabricate (a lie); to forge (a lie); to invent (a story)

content.content: 言い訳をこしらえる
to invent an excuse―make an excuse-find an excuse

こしらえわらい〔拵え笑い〕
〈名〉A forged laugh; a forced smile; an affected smile; a simper; a smirk:(=する) to force a laugh; to force a smile; to smile affectedly; to simper; to smirk

こじり〔鐺〕
〈名〉(=刀の鐺)The tip of a sheath; the scabbard-point

content:
こじる
〈他動〉To prize

content.content: こじ明ける
to prize the lid up―prize a box open―pick a lock

content:
こじれる〔拗れる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=捻れる)to be twisted
2. (=狂う)to go wrong

content.content: 天気がこじれた
The weather has gone wrong.
風邪がこじれるとなかなか直らない
If a cold is not cured in time, it is hard to get rid of.
風邪がこじれて肺炎になる
A cold develops into pneumonia.

content: 3. (=すねる)to sulk; to turn sulky

content.content: 女がこじれると手におえない
When a woman turns sulky, she gets out of hand.

content:
こじん〔個人〕
〈名〉An individual; a private individual; a private person:(=の) individual; personal; private

content.content: 個人としては彼に対して悪感はない
personally,―Individually,―As an individual,―I have no ill-feeling towards him
彼は個人としては好い人だ
He is, personally, a good man.
支那人は個人としてはなかなか開けている
The Chinese are, individually,―as individuals,―in a high state of civilization.
個人としては僕は異存は無い
Personally,―For myself,―Myself,―I have no objection.
これは個人としての僕の意見です
This is my personal opinion.
個人の資格で彼を訪問した
I called on him in my private capacity―in the capacity of a private individual.
個人的
individual
個人性
individuality―personality
個人性の発達した人だ
He is a man of marked individuality.
個人主義
individualism
あの人は個人主義だ
He is an individualist.
個人経営
a private enterprise
個人教授をする
to give private lessons
(新聞の)個人消息欄
a personal column

content:
こじん〔古人〕

content.content: 古人を友とする
to converse with the ancients
古人の言
the sayings of the ancients
これは古人の作である
This is a work of one of the ancients.

content:

content.content: 彼も故人となったか
He is gone then―So he is no more.
故人が遺言をして死んだ
The deceased has left a will.
この室を見ると故人がしのばれる
This room reminds me of the deceased.
故人を慕う
to cherish one's memory
故人のために墓碑を建立する
to erect a monument to one's memory
今は故人の田中君
the late Mr. Tanaka―Mr. Tanaka of happy memory

〈名〉Erroneous diagnosis:(=する) to diagnose erroneously; to make an error in diagnosis; to make a wrong diagnosis

content.content: あの人は個人主義だ

content.content: こせい〔個性〕

ごしんぞう〔御新造〕

content.content: ご新造さん
Missis

〈名〉A sword for self-protection

content:
ごしんよう〔護身用〕
〈形〉For self-protection

content.content: 護身用の武器
a life-preserver

content:
こす〔越す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=越える)to cross (a mountain); to pass (a place); to pass over, go over, cover (so much ground)

content.content: 山を越す
to cross a mountain
峠を越す
to cross a ridge―cross a mountain-pass―(病気の峠なら)―pass the crisis―turn the corner
もう峠を越した
He has turned the corner―The worst is over.
関所を越す
to pass a barrier
幾里の道を越す
to go over―cover―so much ground
駿馬たちまち十里の道を越す
Ten miles is soon gone over on a swift horse.
向こう側へ越す
to cross over to the other side
的を越す
to overshoot the mark
石であの木を越せるか
Can you throw a stone over that tree?
越すに越される恋の道
One can not get over love.

content: 2. (=年などを越す)to pass

content.content: 病人が冬を越すには熱海が好い
Atami is the best place for invalids to pass the winter in.
この林檎は冬が越せるか
Will these apples keep over the winter?
彼は五十の坂を越している
He is past fifty―gone fifty―turned of fifty―on the shady side of fifty.
年を越す
to send off the old year and welcome the new―ring out the old year and ring in the new―winter(in some place)
富士山の頂上で年を越した人がある
Some one has wintered at the summit of Mt. Fuji.

content: 3. (=超過する)to exceed, rise above (some limit)

content.content: 志願者は三千名を越している
The applicants for entrance exceed three thousand―Over three thousand have applied for entrance.
大きさにおいてロンドンを越す都会は無い
No city exceeds London in size.
暑気は九十度を越した
The mercury rose above 90°.
水は膝を越す
The water rises above the knees.
度を越す、程を越す
to go beyond bounds―overstep the bounds―go too far―go to excess
度を越さぬ
to keep within bounds

content: 4. (=勝る)to surpass

content.content: その美しさに越したものは無い
Nothing can surpass its beauty―Nothing can be more beautiful.

That is the best of all―There is nothing like that.

切れ味なら日本刀に越したものは無い

〈副〉
1. Indeed

This is, indeed, a feast for the eye.

content: 2. Just

I can find no article that just suits me.

content.content: 彼こそ君にお誂い向きの人だ
He is the very man for you―just the man for you.
これこそ望むところだ
That is just the thing I want―That is the very thing I want―If that isn't the very thing I long for!
それこそ好かろう

今夜こそ思う存分遊んでやる
I will have my fill of pleasure this very night.
今度こそ成功してみせる
I will succeed now or never.
今夜こそ逃がさないぞ
He shall not escape me this time.

content: 4. (形容詞に訳し)downright

content.content: これこそ立派な詐欺だ

It is I that must thank you.

It is not I, but he, that is wrong.

It is for your good that I say this―It is out of kindness that I say this―It is because I have your interests at heart that I say this.
