content.content: 病気のほかはどんなことがあっても学校を休むな
You must not absent yourself from school on any account, unless you are ill.
どんなことがあってもそんなことはしません
On no account will I do such a thing.
彼は些細なことで立腹する
He takes offence on the slightest provocation―at trifles.

content:
11. 
〈動詞に訳す場合〉

content.content: それは僕の不在中のことだ
It happened in my absence.
御不在中のことはお知らせ申します
I will inform you of whatever happens in your absence.
彼らは事あれかしと待っている
They are watching for something to happen.
これは何のことか
What does this mean?
君は誰のことを言っているのか
Whom do you mean?―Whom do you allude to?
このことか
Do you mean this?
それはいったい何のことじゃ
What do you mean by that?
海老で鯛を釣るというのはこのことだ
This is what is meant by “throwing a sprat to catch a whale.”
Y. M. C. A.とは何のことか
What does Y. M. C. A. stand for?
キリスト教青年会のことさ
Y. M. C. A. stands for“the Young Men's Christian Association.”
政治を事とする
to deal in politics
教師たる者はこっけいのみを事とすべからず
A teacher should not deal in humour alone.

content:
12. 
〈助動詞に訳す場合〉

content.content: 僕は行ったことは行ったが彼は不在であった
I did go to see him, but he was not at home.
彼は勉強することは勉強するがどういうものか成功しない
He does work hard, but somehow he does not succeed.
貧をはじることは無い
You need no be ashamed of poverty.
急ぐことは無い
You need not make haste―There is no occasion for haste.

content:
13. 
〈不定法に訳す場合〉

content.content: 見ること
to see―seeing
本を読むことが好きだ
I like to read―I am fond of reading.
会は次の日曜に開くことになっている
The meeting is to be held next Sunday.
彼が僕の後任になることになっている
He is to be my successor―He is to take my place.

content:
14. 
〈副詞に訳す場合〉

content.content: 何々したことがある
once―(したことがあるか)―ever (?)―(したことが無い)―never
僕は長崎に居たことがある
I once lived in Nagasaki.
彼に逢ったことがあるか
Did you ever meet him?
逢ったことが無い
I never met him.［注意］この意味を表すに往々 Perfect Tense を用いる。
君は洋行したことがあるか
Did you ever go abroad?―Have you been abroad?
この本を読んだことがある
I have read this book.

content:
15. 
〈前置詞に訳す場合〉

content.content: 試験のことは心配するな
Do not make yourself uneasy about the examination.
彼が死んだことを聞いたか
Have you heard of his death?
彼が死んだことを知っている
I know of his death.
今日は田中くんのことで参上しました
I have called on behalf of Mr. Tanaka.

content:
16. 
〈接続詞に訳す場合〉 That

content.content: 彼が死んだということを聞いた
I have heard that he is dead.
彼が辞職したということは本当か
Is it true that he has resigned?

content:
17. 
〈代名詞に訳す場合〉 What

content.content: 僕の為した事
what I have done―my action
君のした事は間違っている
What you have done, is wrong―(と言わずして)―You have done wrong.―(と言う)
君の言うこと
what you say―your statement.
君の言うことは本当か
Is what you say true?―(と言わずして)―Do you speak the truth?―(と言う)［注意］「人の言う事」を略して代名詞のみを用いる動詞あり。
僕の言うことを聞いてくれ
Hear me!―Listen to me!
君の言うことを信ぜぬ
I do not believe you.
僕の言うことがわかったか
Do you understand me?
俺の言うことを聴け
You must obey me.
辛いことだ
It's hard―It is hard lines for me.
結構なことだ
I am glad of it.
結構なことには彼も今度及第しました
He has, I am glad to say, passed his examination.
残念なことだ
I am sorry for it.
残念なことには落第しました
I have, I am sorry to say, failed in my examination.
気の毒なことだ
I am sorry for him.
悲しいことには彼は日増しに悪くなるばかり
Sad to say, he goes on growing worse and worse every day.
しかし妙なことには職務を怠らない
But, strange to say,―curious to relate,―Oddly enough,―he does not neglect his duties.
不思議なことには少しもけがをしなかった
Wonderful to say,―For a wonder,―he was not injured at all.
まあ綺麗なこと
How pretty!
好いことじゃ
How good!
彼は学者だということだ
He is said to be a scholar.
彼は毎日散歩することにしている
He makes it a rule to take a walk every day―He is in the habit of taking a walk every day.
詳しいことは知らない
I do not know the particulars.
彼は詳しいことは言わなかった
He did not enter into details.
急ぐことは無い
There is no occasion for haste.
急いでは事を仕損ずる
“Haste is waste.”
とかく町内事無かれ
“Anything for a quiet life”
一朝事あらば
in time of need―in case of need―in case of emergency
ひと足のことで汽車に乗り後れた
I missed the train by a step.
彼は日に十時間の授業を事ともせぬ
He makes nothing of teaching ten hours a day.
事を欠く
to want for anything
彼は日々の生活にも事を欠いている
He wants for the necessaries of life.
ことによるとそうかも知れぬ
Perhaps it is so―It may be so.
事をわけて話す
to speak reason
事を好む
to be a meddler―quixotic
そりゃありそうなことだ
That is very likely―enough.
そんなことがあってたまるものか
That is impossible.
沈着もって事に当たる
to proceed with calmness
貴方のことなら
I can refuse you nothing.

content:
ごと
〈接尾詞〉... and all; together with...

content.content: 骨ごと食う、頭ごと食う、殻ごと食う
Eat it, bones and all―head and all―shell and all.
箱ごと持って来い
Bring them, box and all―together with the box.
家を地所ごと買った
I have bought the house, together with the land.

ことう〔古刀〕
〈名〉An old Japanese sword (made in or before the Sixteenth Century)

content:
ことう〔孤島〕
〈名〉A solitary island; a desert island

content.content: 絶海の孤島
a solitary island in mid-ocean
水夫の犯罪者を孤島に棄てる
to maroon a culprit (on a desert island)

ことう〔孤灯〕
〈名〉An arc-light; an arc-lamp

content:
こどう〔鼓動〕
〈名〉(The heart's) beat, pulse, pulsation:(=する) to beat; to pulsate

content.content: 心臓が鼓動する
The heart beats―The heart pulsates.
心臓の鼓動が早い
The heart beats fast.
心臓が割れるかと思うほどはげしく鼓動した
I thought my heart would burst, it beat so thick and fast.

content:
ごどう〔悟道〕
〈名〉Spiritual enlightenment; the water of life; philosophy

content.content: 悟道に入る
to be spiritually enlightened―drink the water of life―find one's philosophy

こどうぐ〔古道具〕
〈名〉Old furniture; second-hand articles

content:
こどうぐ〔小道具〕
〈名〉(=芝居の小道具)Property; stage-property

content.content: 小道具方
the property-man―the property-master

ごとうくじら〔五島鯨〕
〈名〉The grampus

content:
ことがら〔事柄〕
〈名〉A matter; an affair; a circumstance

content.content: これは公にすべき事柄でない
This is not a matter to be made public.
彼に金銭上の事柄を相談したことが無い
I never talked with him about money matters.
彼は教育上の事柄に明るい
He is conversant with educational affairs.
彼の結婚に関する事柄を君は知らないのか
Don't you know the circumstance that attended his marriage?

content:
ごとき〔如き〕
〈形〉Like; such as

content.content: 秀吉の如き英雄はたんと無い
There are not many heroes like Hideyoshi.
鷹や鷲の如き猛禽はたんと卵を生まない
Birds of prey, such as the hawk and the eagle, do not lay many eggs.
僕の如き賤い者にはもったいない
It is not for the likes of me.
君の如く偉い人にも似合わぬ
It is not becoming in the likes of you.
夢の如き生活
a dream-like existence
山の如き浪
a mountain of a wave
かくの如きに状態あり
It is in such a state.
名誉を害するが如き悪口ではない
The remark is not such as to injure one's reputation―of a nature to injure one's reputation.
ロシアの如きは一時は無政府も同然であった
Russia, for instance, was in a state of anarchy for a time.

こときれる〔事切れる〕
〈自動〉To breathe one's last; to expire; to die

content:
こどく〔孤独〕
〈名〉(状態)solitude:(人)a solitary; a hermit; a recluse; a lonely old man; a forlorn widow; an orphan; a bachelor; a spinster:(=の) solitary; lonely

content.content: 我れは孤独の身
I am alone in the world―alone in the wide, wide world―a solitary.
孤独の生活をする
to lead a solitary life―lead a lonely life
孤独の身は哀れなものだ
A bachelor's life is wretched.
我れは孤独を愛す
I love solitude―I love my own company―I like to keep to myself.
孤独を憐れめ
Take pity on widows and orphans!

ごとく〔五徳〕
〈名〉A trivet; a tripod

content:
ごとく〔如く〕
〈前置詞相当〉Like

content.content: 鳥の如く飛ぶ
to fly like a bird

content: 〈接続詞〉As

content.content: 鳥の飛ぶ如く飛ぶ
to fly as a bird does
雪の如く白し
It is (as) white as snow.
上述の如く
as stated above

ことくに〔異国〕
〈名〉A foreign land

content:
ことごとく〔悉く〕
〈副〉Every; everything; everybody; every one of them; every mother's son of them; all; one and all; wholly; entirely; completely; utterly; to a man; to the last man; without (an) exception

content.content: この種類の字書はことごとく参考した
I have consulted every dictionary―all the dictionaries―of the kind.
手段という手段はことごとく尽した
I have tried every means in my power―left no means untried―left no stones unturned.
この本にあることはことごとく知っている
I know everything in the book.
今度の挙にはことごとく反対だ
Everybody is opposed to the project.
生徒はことごとく知っている
I know the students, every one of them―every mother's son of them.
本の内容はことごとく新しい
The contents of the book are wholly new―entirely new.
僕は図書館の本をことごとく読み尽した
I have exhausted the library.
記事はことごとく虚説だ
The account is utterly false.
彼らはことごとく僕に反対した
They were against me to a man.
ことごとく戦死した
They fell fighting to a man―to the last man.
負債はことごとく返済した
I have paid my debts to the last sen.
船長はことごとく日本人だ
The captains are Japanese without an exception.
ことごとく書を信ずれば書無きに如かず
Better read no books than believe everything you read.
ことごとく列挙する
to run through the catalogue of great names

content:
ことごとしい〔事々しい〕
〈形〉Pompous (language); bombastic (style); exaggerated (account); sounding (rhetoric); high-sounding (title); consequential (air); ostentatious (display); fussy (activity, etc.)

content.content: 言葉遣いが事々しい
The language is pompous.
文体が事々しい
The style is bombastic.
あの人の物の言い方が事々しい
He has an exaggerated way of saying things―He speaks with a consequential air.
事々しい文言を並べる
to array sounding rhetoric
事々しい肩書を持っている
He has a high-sounding title.
事々しく見せ開かす
to make an ostentatious display
事々しく乗り込んだ
He came upon the town with a flourish of trumpets―with all the pomp and circumstances of war.
事々しく騒ぎたてる
to make a fuss about trifles―make much ado about nothing

content:
ことごとに〔事毎に〕
〈副〉In everything

content.content: 手を出すことごとに失敗した
I failed in everything I undertook.

content:
ことこまかに〔事細かに〕
〈副〉Minutely; particularly; circumstantially; in detail

content.content: 事細かに物語る
to give a minute account―give a circumstantial account―give a detailed account―give the full particulars

content:
ことさらに〔殊更に〕
〈副〉
1. (=故意に)intentionally; designedly, by design; purposely, on purpose of set purpose; deliberately

content.content: ことさらにしたことではない
It was not done on purpose―The action was not intentional.
ことさらにしたこととしか思えぬ
I can not but think that it was an intentional act―a designed action―a deliberate action.

content: 2. (=殊に)especially, in especial; particularly, in particular

content.content: 天文はことさらに船乗りに必要だ
Astronomy is especially important to mariners.
ことさらにこの点にご注意を願います
I wish to call your especial attention to this point.
ことさらに語学の研究をお勧め申す
I would advise you to study the languages in especial.
始めがことさらに困難だ
The beginning is particularly difficult.
ことさらに誰を指して言うわけではない
I do not mean any one in particular.
ことさらに説明する必要はない
No particular explanation is needed.

content:
ことし〔今年〕
〈名、副〉This year; the current year

content.content: 今年は豊年だ
This is a good year.
今年も残り少なくなりました
The year draws to a close.
彼は今年帰朝する
He returns from abroad this year.
今年中に帰る
He will return in the course of the year―before the year is out.

ことじ〔琴柱〕
〈名〉The bridges (of a Japanese harp)

content:
ごとし〔如し〕
〈叙述形容詞〉Like

content.content: 真人は小児の如し
A true man is like a child.
人生は航海の如し
Life is like a voyage―Life is may be likened to a voyage.
符節を合わすが如し
They are feature for feature alike.［注意］往々“like”を略すことあり、例えば
智徳は車の両輪の如し
Knowledge and virtue are (like) the two wheels of a cart.
人生は夢の如し
“Life is a dream.”
人生は朝露の如し
“Life is a bubble.”

content: 〈接続詞〉As; what

content.content: 読書の精神におけるなお食物の身体に於けるが如し
Reading nourishes the mind as food does the mind―Reading is to the mind what food is to the body.
君子の交わり淡きこと水の如し
“Great men meet as water meets water.”
左の如し
They are as follows:―

content: 〈動詞〉To seem

content.content: 敵は攻勢を開始せんとするものの如し
The enemy seem to be about to take the aggressive.

content: 〈その他〉

content.content: 仕事は山の如し
I have mountains of work to get through.
ご馳走山の如し
There are a power of good things.
礼状山の如し
Letters of thanks pour in from all quarters.
綸言汗の如し
An Emperor's word, once passed, never returns.
あたかも雲を踏むが如し
I feel as if I were treading on air.
木に縁って魚を求むるが如し
One might as well go to a tree for fish.

content:
ことたる〔事足る〕
〈自動〉To suffice; to be sufficient; to answer the purpose; to serve one's turn; to do (the business)

content.content: 暮らしには月百円で事足りる
One hundred yen a month will suffice―will do―to live on.
着物は何でも事足りる
Any clothes will answer my purpose―will serve my turn―will do.
ぜいたく品は無くて事足りる
I can do without luxuries.
事足れば足るに
The man who has enough and more,
任せて事足らず
On more and more his soul is bent;
足らで事足りる
How truly happy is the boor,
身こそ安けれ
Who with a little is content!

content:
ことづけ〔言付け〕
〈名〉A verbal message:(=する) to send (one) a message; to send (one) word

content.content: 行かれないと言づけしてやった
I have sent them word that I can not come.
彼は来られないと言づけしてよこした
He has sent us word that he can not come.
その人は僕に何か言づけをして行かないか
Has he left any message for me?
お前に何か言づけを頼んで行かないか
Has he left any message with you?
その方はまた来ると言うお言づけをして行かれました
He has left a message for you―left a message with me―that he will call again.
お父様からお言づけがありませんか
Any message from your father?
田中君に君への言づけを頼まれた
I am charged by Mr. Tanaka with a message for you.
田中君から君に言づけがある
I have a message for you from Mr. Tanaka.
彼に言づけをしてくれたろうね
You have delivered him my message,―conveyed him my message,―given him my massage,―I hope?

ことづける〔言付ける〕
〈他動〉To charge, entrust (one with a commission)

content:
ことづて〔言伝〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ことづけ〔言付け〕
でんごん〔伝言〕

ことづめ〔琴爪〕
〈名〉Ivory nails (for playing on the harp)

content:
こととする〔事とする〕
〈他動〉To deal in (politics); to devote oneself to (something); to make it one's business (to do something)

content.content: 教師たるものはこっけいのみを事とするべからず
A teacher should not deal in humour alone.
彼は英語研究ただこれを事としている
He devotes himself to the study of English.
彼は人の穴捜しを事としている
He makes it his business to find faults in others.

content:
ことなる〔異なる〕
〈自動〉To differ (from others); to be different (from others); to be unlike (others)

content.content: 彼我の習慣が異なっている
Our customs differ from theirs―Our customs are different from theirs.
これとそれとは大いに異なっている
This is widely different from that.
各国の語はおのおの習慣が異なっている
Each language has its own idioms.
人の心の異なるはその顔面の異なるが如し
You will as soon find two of a face as two of a mind.
魚の空気無くして生活しあたわざること陸動物と異なること無し
A fish can not live without air any more than a land-animal can.

content: 〈形〉Different (from others); unlike (others)

content.content: 兄弟はおのおの異なる性格をそなえている
Each of the brothers has a different character.
二者の異なる点はここだ
Herein lies the difference between the two.

content:
ことなれる〔異なれる〕
〈形〉Different (from others); unlike (others)

content.content: 各々他と異なれる性格をそなえている
Each has a different character from the others―Each is unlike the others.

content:
ことに〔殊に〕
〈副〉
1. (=分けて)especially; in especial; particularly; in particular

content.content: 天文は殊に船乗りに必要だ
Astronomy is especially important to mariners.
殊にこの点にご注意を願います
I wish to call your especial attention to this point.
始めが殊に困難だ
The beginning is particularly difficult.
殊に語学の研究をお勧め申す
I would advise you to study the languages in especial.
殊に誰を指して言うのではない
I do not mean any one in particular.

content: 2. (=何はさて置き)above all things; before everything; of all things; best of all; most of all:(打消に伴えば)least of all

content.content: 実業界では殊に時間を守ることが必要だ
In business, you must, above all, be punctual.
学生には殊に学問が大事だ
A student should, before everything,attend to his studies.
それは殊に面白かろう
I shall enjoy it of all things.
僕はすべて運動は好きだが殊に銃猟が好きだ
I am fond of all games, but I love shooting best of all.
誰にでも丁寧にせよ、殊に婦人に対して
Be polite to everybody, but,most of all, to the ladies.
粗暴な振舞をするな、殊に婦人に向かっては
Don't be rude to anybody, least of all, to the ladies.

content:
ごとに〔毎に〕
〈接尾詞〉Every

content.content: 電車は五分ごとにたつ
The cars start every five minutes―at intervals of five minutes.
ひと足ごとに深くなる
The water becomes deeper at every step.
ひと雨ごとに殖える
to increase with every rainfall
二時間ごとに服用
To be taken every two hours.
英国では七年ごとに土地を休ませる
In England, lands are allowed to lie fallow every seven years―every eighth year.
家あるごとに立ち止まった
I stopped at every house.
家ごとに旗を出す
Every house puts up its flag.
逢う人ごとにそう言う
Every man I meet, say so.
彼に逢うたびごとに意見する
I talk seriously to him every time I meet him―whenever I meet him―as often as I meet him.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 戸ごとに乞う
He begs from door to door.

content:
ことにする〔異にする〕
〈他動〉To differ (in some point); to be different (in some respect)

content.content: 僕は君と意見を異にする
We differ in opinion―I must differ with you.
二人意見を異にする時は一人は必ず間違っているのに違い無い、また双方共間違っていることがある
When two men differ in opinion, one must be wrong, and both may be wrong.
二人は全然性格を異にしている
The two are entirely different in character.
彼我習慣を異にする
We differ in custom―Our customs are different from theirs.
この著者は世間にありふれた本と選を異にしている
The work is entirely different from common books―not to be classed with common books.
二者長短を異にす
They are different in length―(長所短所なら)―They have different merits and faults.
国語はおのおのその習慣を異にする
Each language has its own idioms.
僕は日本人と西洋人と取扱いを異にしない
I do not discriminate between Japanese and foreigners.

content:
ことによったら〔事に依ったら〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: ことによると〔事に依ると〕

content:
ことによると〔事に依ると〕
〈副〉Perhaps; possibly; maybe; for aught one knows

content.content: 事によるとそうかも知れぬ
Perhaps it is so―It may be so―Maybe it is so.
戦争のことだから事によったら日本が負けるかも知れぬ
In the event of a war, Japan may possibly be defeated.
あの西洋人は事によったら米探かも知れぬ
He may be an American spy for aught we know.

content:
ことのは〔言の葉〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ことば〔言葉〕

content:
ことのほか〔殊の外〕
〈副〉
1. (=案外)contrary to expectation; beyond expectation; more than one expected ［thought, hoped, feared］

content.content: 仕事はことのほか骨が折れる
I find my work harder than I expected.
試験はことのほかやさしかった
The examination was easier than I had expected.
君の病気はことのほか早く治った
You have recovered sooner than I expected―sooner than I hoped.
損はことのほか少ない
The loss is less than I expected―less than I feared.

content: 2. (=非常に)extremely; exceedingly; uncommonly; exceptionally; beyond measure

content.content: ことのほかお世話になりました
I am extremely obliged to you.
成績はことのほか良い
The result is exceedingly good.
暑気はことのほか厳しい
The heat is uncommonly sever―exceptionally severe.
親父はことのほか悦びました
My father was rejoiced beyond measure.

content:
ことば〔言葉〕
〈名〉
1. (語)a word; a term:(熟語)a phrase; an expression

content.content: 思想は言葉をもっていい表す
Thoughts are expressed by means of words.
君は妙な言葉を使う
You use curious words―curious expressions―curious phrases.
言葉をはさむ
to put in a word―interpose
言葉写しに繰返す
to repeat word for word―verbatim
言葉に窮した
I am at a loss for a word.
この言葉には故事がある
The phrase has a historical origin.
仏教臭い言葉だ
The expression savours of Buddhism.
学術の言葉
a technical term
専門家の言葉で言えば
To express it in technical terms,...
きれいな言葉
a delicate expression
うまい言葉
a happy expression
君は言葉数を知っているから好い
You have a large vocabulary―an extensive vocabulary.
僕は言葉数を知らないから困る
I have a limited vocabulary.

content: 2. (=国語)a language; a tongue

content.content: 日本の言葉
the Japanese language―the Japanese tongue-Japanese
彼は方々の言葉に通じている
He speaks several languages.
世界中に通ずる言葉は英語だけだ
English is the only language that is spoken all the world over.
二人は言葉が通じない
They can not understand each other.
初めて洋行した時、言葉が通じなくて困った
The first time I went abroad, I could not make myself understood.
君は生徒に言葉が通ずるか
Can you make yourself understood by your students?

content: 3. (=言語)speech; language; expression; words

content.content: 謝するに言葉無し(このありがたさは言葉に尽せぬ)
I know not what words to thank you―I can never thank you enough―My gratitude is beyond my power of expression.
言葉を飾る
to adorn one's speech
言葉の花
flowers of speech―figures of speech
上品な言葉
refined language―chaste language
下等な言葉
vulgar language
平凡な言葉
commonplace expressions―hackneyed expressions―trite expressions
過激な言葉
strong language―violent language
曖昧な言葉
ambiguous words
赤心から出る言葉
words that flow from one's heart―sincere words
言葉を慎む
to control one's speech―bridle one's tongue―weigh one's words
言葉を荒らげる
to break out into violent language
言葉を荒らげて言う
to speak in violent language―speak with vehemence
人と言葉を交わす
to bandy words with one
人の言葉をとがめる
to cavil at one's words―catch one tripping―set one right
人の言葉の先を折る
to interrupt one in one's speech
言葉に力を入れて言う
to lay stress on one's words―speak with emphasis
言葉を換えて言えば
in other words,―that is to say
言葉の少ない人だ
He is a man of few words―a taciturn man.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 人と言葉を交える
to talk with one―speak with one
人に言葉をかける
to speak to one―accost one
知らない人に言葉をかけられた
I was accosted by a stranger.
彼はその娘に優しい言葉をかけた
He spoke kindly to her.
言葉をつかえる
to promise―make a promise―give one's word
言葉を違える
to break one's promise―break one's word
言葉を濁す
to equivocate―prevaricate―shift and prevaricate
それではお言葉に甘えて
Then I shall presume upon your kindness.
言葉を返す
to talk back―answer back―retort
東北人は言葉が鼻にかかる
People from the North-east speak through the nose.
答えるに言葉無し
I am at a loss for an answer.
売言葉に買言葉
(to give) tit for tat
その風景はことばに尽くせぬ
The scenery is beautiful beyond description―The beauty of scenery beggars description.

content: 4. (=方言)a dialect

content.content: 田舎言葉
a country dialect―a provincial dialect―a rustic dialect
大阪言葉
the Osaka dialect
国によって言葉が違う
The dialect varies with the province.
言葉は国の手形
The dialect is the index of the province.
ことばづかい〔言葉遣〕

ことばあらそい〔言葉争い〕
〈名〉
1. (=言葉での争い)an altercation; a wrangling
2. (=言葉についての争い)logomachy

ことばがえし〔言葉返し〕
〈名〉
1. (=言い返し)a retort:(=する) to retort; to talk back; to answer back
2. (=即答)a repartee:(=する) to repartee; to make a repartee

ことばがたき〔言葉仇敵〕
〈名〉One's crony

content:
ことばじり〔言葉尻〕
〈名〉
1. (=語尾)the end of one's sentence
2. (=言い損い)a slip of the tongue

content.content: 言葉尻を取る
to cavil at one's words―catch one tripping

content:
ことばぞえ〔言葉添え〕
〈名〉Putting in a good word for(one)

content.content: なにとぞお言葉添えを願います
You will please put in a good word for me―say a good word for me.

ことばたがい〔言葉違い〕
〈名〉
1. (=自家撞着)self-contradiction:(=する) to contradict oneself
2. (=破約)breach of promise:(=する) to break one's promise
3. (=言い争い)an altercation:(=する) to altercate (with one)

content:
ことばづかい〔言葉遣〕
〈名〉Expression; wording; diction; phraseology

content.content: その言葉遣いは正しい
You express yourself correctly.
それは間違った言葉遣いだ
That is a wrong expression―a solecism.
言葉遣いの誤り
a solecism
言葉遣いを誤る
to commit a solecism
無理な言葉遣いをする
to use impossible expressions―do violence to grammar
この詩は言葉遣いがきれいだ
The poem is prettily worded.
詩の言葉遣いは自ら散文と違う
The diction of poetry is naturally different from that of prose.
専門家は言葉遣いが違う
A professional man has a phraseology of his own.

ことばとがめ〔言葉咎め〕
〈名〉Cavilling at one's words:(=する) to cavil at one's words; to catch (one) tripping

ことぶき〔寿〕
〈名〉
1. (=長命)a long life; longevity
2. (=年令)age
3. (=祝賀)congratulation; felicitation

ことぶく〔寿く〕
〈他動〉To congratulate, felicitate (one on the occasion); to wish (one) joy (of the occasion)

ことほぐ〔言祝ぐ〕
〈他動〉To congratulate, felicitate (one on the occasion); to wish (one) joy (of the occasion)

content:
こども〔子供〕
〈名〉A child(複数―children):(男なら)a boy; a son:(女なら)a girl; a daughter:(男女とも)a youngster; a kid:(生まれたてなら)a baby:(幼ないなら)an infant:(集合的に言えば)little ones; a family; offspring; issue

content.content: あの人は子どもが有る
He has a family―He is a family man.
子どもが無い
He has no family―His issue fails.
あの人は子どもを持ったことが無い
He never had a family.
あの女は子どもを持ったことが無い
She never had a child.
子どもを持たない者は情けを知らぬ
One who has no child knows not what love is.
夫婦は子どもが大勢ある
The couple have many children―a large family―a numerous offspring.
好い子どもを持っている
They are blessed with good children.
彼は子どもが無かった、男の子どもが無かった
He died without issue―died without male issue.
先妻の子どもが三人ある
He has three children by his first wife.
妾腹の子どもがある
He has a child by a concubine.
子どもが生まれる、子どもができる
A child is born―A baby is born.
あの娘は子どもができた
She has a child―She has become a mother.
二人の間に子どもができた
The couple had a child between them.
二人の間にできた子どもが有名な太郎
The fruit of their union was the famous Taro.
子どもを生む
to bear children―bring forth a child―give birth to a child―have a child
女は子どもを生む(役)
Women bear children.
彼の細君は子どもを五人生んだ
His wife bore him five children―gave him five children.
先妻は子どもを二人生んで死んだ
His first wife died after giving birth to two children.
あの女は子どもを七人生んだ
She has seven children―She is the mother of seven children.
彼女は子どもを生んだことが無い
She never had a child.
子どもを生む年の女
a woman of child-bearing age
彼女はもう子どもを生む年じゃない
She is past the age of bearing.
子どもを孕む
to conceive a child
子どもを孕んでいる
She is (They are) with child―pregnant―in the family way―in an interesting condition.
腹の子ども
a child in the womb―an unborn child
女は罪人でも腹の子どもには罪は無い
The woman may be a criminal, but the child in her womb is innocent.
腹の子どもの始末はどうして下さる
What are your intentions regarding her unborn child?
(男が)子どもを設ける
to beget a child―get a child
子どもをこしらえる
to strike off a child―knock off a child
子どもを育てる
to bring up a child―rear a child―raise a family
子どもを牛乳で育てる
to bring up a child on the bottle―bring up a child by the hand
子どもは牛乳でよく育つ
A child thrives on cow's milk.
可愛い子どもは棒で育てろ
“Spare the rod, and spoil the child.”
可愛い子どもには旅をさせろ
If you love your child, send him out into the world.
子どもを可愛いがる
to love one's children
あまり可愛がると子どもが甘ったれる
If you make too much of your child, it gets spoilt―You spoil your child by making too much of him.
子どもをあやす
to caress a child
子どもを膝の上であやす
(男なら)He dances the baby on his knees―(女なら)―She dandles the baby in her lap.
子どもを養う
to feed one's little ones―provide for one's family
彼は大勢の子どもを養わなけりゃならない
He has a large family to provide for.
子どもの世話をする
(自分の子どもなら)to care for one's child―(他人の子なら)―take care of a child
子どもの世話をする女が欲しい
I want a female to take care of my children―to look after my children.
子どもを里に預ける
put out a child to nurse
子どもは親に依頼する
Children depend on their parents.
子どもが親の世話になるのは当たり前だ
It is quit natural that a child should depend on its parents.
親が子どもの世話をするのは当たり前だ
It is proper that a father should care for his children.
子どもが親の手を離れる
A child leaves its parents―A son becomes independent of his father.
子どもは夫婦のかすがい
A child is the pledge of affection.
子どもを勘当する
to disown a child―disinherit a son―cut off a son with a shilling
子どもを棄てる
to desert a child―expose a child
不具な子どもほど可愛い
A deformed child is all the dearer to its parents.
ばかな子どもほど可愛い
A dunce is all the dearer to his parent.
彼は子どもの時に両親に死に別れた
He lost both his parents when a child―in his infancy.
あの人は子どもの時から知っている
I have know him since he was a child―since his childhood―from a child.
子どもの時から賢かった
He was wise from his childhood upward.
子どもの時から語学の才があった
He early showed an aptitude for languages.
あの番頭は子どもの時から三十年いる
He has lived with us, man and boy, for thirty years.
子どもは智慧がつく
The child grows in intelligence.
君は子どもに甘い
You are too indulgent to your children.
子どもに甘い母
a fond mother
子どもは耳が早い
“Little pitchers have long ears.”
子どもは正直だ
“Children and fools tell the truth.”
子どもではあるまいし泣くな
Don't be a child!―Be a man, and don't cry!
僕はませた子どもが嫌いだ
I don't like a precocious child―an old head on young shoulders.
勉強ばかりさせて遊ばせないと子どもがばかになる
“All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy.”
弱い子どもにはありがちのことだが彼はたいそう学問にこった
He flung himself into books, as children of weak constitution will.
そんなことは子どもでも知っている
A child knows that.
年をとるとこどもに返る
Old age is a second childhood―Old men are twice children.
あの娘は子どもだ子どもだと思っているうちに子ができた
She has become a mother while I thought her a child.
彼は子ども子どもしている
He looks childish.

こどもくさい〔子供臭い〕
〈形〉Childish; puerile

こどもしばい〔子供芝居〕
〈名〉A juvenile theatre

こどもじみた〔子供じみた〕
〈形〉Childish; puerile

content:
こどもだまし〔子供騙し〕
〈名〉A trick to deceive children; a shallow trick; shallow trickery

content.content: そんな子どもだましにかかる者はありはしまい
No man will be imposed upon by such shallow trickery.

content: 〈形〉Puerile; silly

content.content: そんな子どもだましの言い訳で誰が承知するものか
Who will be satisfied with such a silly excuse?
この本は子どもだましだ
The book is puerile.

content:
こともなげに〔事も無げに〕
〈副〉Carelessly

content.content: なにこれしきのことと事も無げに言った
He spoke carelessly of the matter as a trifle.

こどもらしい〔子供らしい〕
〈形〉Childish; puerile

content:
ことよせる〔事寄せる〕
〈自動〉To pretend (to be ill); to make a pretence of (illness, etc.)

content.content: 彼は病気に事寄せて面会を謝絶した
He declined to see me under pretence of illness―on the pretence of illness―on the plea of illness―under plea of illness.

ことり〔小鳥〕
〈名〉A small bird; a little bird

content:
ことわざ〔諺〕
〈名〉A proverb; an adage; a common saying

content.content: 諺に曰く
The proverb says...
諺にもある通り「窮鳥枝を選ばず」と言うから
As the saying is, “Beggars should not be choosers.”
紺屋の明後日は諺になっている
The dyer is proverbially behind time with his work.

content:
ことわり〔断り〕
〈名〉
1. (=予告)notice; warning

content.content: 前もってお断りが無ければできません
It can not be done without previous notice.
三日前にお断りが無ければできません
Three day's notice is required.
前日お断りがあればできます
A day's notice will do.
一カ月前の断りで雇人に暇を出すのが西洋の習慣だ
It is the custom in foreign countries to give a servant a month's warning.
断り無しに暇を出された
I was dismissed without warning.
断り無しに欠席する
to absent oneself without notice―play truant

content: 2. (=拒絶、謝絶)refusal; declination; non-acceptance

content.content: お断りです
I beg to decline.
お気の毒だがお断りです
I am sorry I must refuse your request―I am sorry I can not oblige you.
そんな条件ではお断りです
I must decline your offer―I can not accept your offer―on such terms.
貸売いっさいお断り
No credit allowed―Trust is dead.
夜学はお断りです
I object to teaching evenings.

content: 3. (=禁止)Prohibition

content.content: 左の条々堅くお断り
The following are strictly prohibited:―

content: 4. (=許可)permission; leave

content.content: 断り無しに出掛けてはいかん
You must not go out without permission―without leave.

content: 5. (=言い訳)an excuse

content.content: 伊藤さんからお断りです
Mr. Ito has sent an excuse―Mr. Ito excuses himself (from coming).
断りの手紙
a note of excuse―a note of regret

content:
ことわり〔理〕
〈名〉Reason

content.content: お前がそう言うのも理だ
You have good reason to say so―You may well say that.
君の言う事にも多少理がある
There is some reason in what you say―There is something in that.
彼が成功するのも理だ(理なる哉)
It is natural that he should succeed―It is no wonder that he should succeed―It is no great wonder that he should succeed―What wonder that he should succeed!

ことわりじょう〔断り状〕
〈名〉A note of non-acceptance; a note of excuse; a note of regret

content:
ことわる〔断る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=予告する)to warn; to give (one) warning; to give (one) notice; to tell

content.content: 前もって断る
to give one previous notice
三日前に断る
to give one three days' notice
(後から苦情の出ないように)予め断っておく
I give you due warning―give you fair warning.
君に断っておくがもっと勉強しないと落第ですよ
I give you fair warning that, if you do not work harder, you will fail.
西洋では雇人を断る時には一カ月の猶予を与える
In foreign countries, they give their servants a month's warning.
彼には一カ月の猶予を与えて断りました
I have given him a month's warning.
主人に来月やめると断った
I have given my master notice that I leave next month.
借家人に家を明けるように断った
I have given my tenant notice to quit.
家を明けるように断られた
I have had notice to quit.
ちょっと読者にお断りしておくが
I make bold to tell my reader that...
ちょっとお断りしておきますが何もご馳走はありません
I must tell you that you must put up with poor fare.
彼にもう来てはいけないときっぱり断るがよい
You ought to tell him once for all that he must not come any more.

content: 2. (=拒絶する、謝絶する)to refuse; to decline

content.content: 招待を断る
to decline an invitation
人の依頼を断る
to refuse a request
おぼしめしのほどはありがたいがお断り致します
I am thankful for your kind intentions, but beg to decline.
体好く断った
I declined with thanks.
そんなことはできぬと断然断った
I positively refused―flatly refused―squarely refused―refused point-blank―to do so.
一も二も無く断られた
I was met by a flat refusal―met by a square rebuff.
お気の毒ですがそれはお断り申します
I am sorry I must refuse your request―I am sorry I can not oblige you.
そんな条件ではお断り申します
I must decline your offer―I can not accept your offer―on such terms.
彼は病気と称して面会を断った
He declined to see me under pretence of illness.
病院がいっぱいで入院を断っている
The hospital is full, and declining to take in new patients.
註文を断る
to decline an order
ちと大きな註文を引受けて他のご註文はお断りしております
We have taken up a large order, and are obliged to decline all others.
註文(したもの)を断る
to cancel an order
弁当を断ってくれ
Cancel the order for my lunch.
貸売いっさいお断り申候
No credit allowed.
贈花の儀はお断り申候
Floral gifts are declined.
その儀ばかりはお断り申します
I will do anything but that.
せっかくのお志ですが残念ながらお断り致します
I am sorry I can not avail myself of your kind offer.
人を断る
to decline one's services―tell a man that his services are not wanted
断るなら早く断るがよい
If you do not want him, say so at once.
君はこれからはお断りする
I must dispense with your services.
その人を断りました
I have declined his further services―told him that he is not wanted any more.
芸者がお座敷を断る
to A geisha declines an engagement

content: 3. (=禁止する)to prohibit

content.content: 車内の喫煙はその筋の命により堅くお断り申候
Smoking in the cars is strictly prohibited by order―No smoking in the cars.

content: 4. (=許可を乞う)to ask permission

content.content: 断って入ればよいでしょう
I have only to ask permission to enter, haven't I?
誰に断ってこの金を使いましたか
By whose permission―On whose authority―did you appropriate the money?

content: 5. (=言い訳する)to excuse oneself

content.content: 僕は任に堪えないからご免を蒙ると言って断った
I have excused myself from the task, for I am unequal to it.
今晩はお断りして下さい、用があって行かれないと断って下さい
Please excuse me to them for this evening―Please tell them that I am too busy to come.
行くのを断ってやった
I have excused myself from coming―sent them word that I can not come.
伊藤さんから病気で来られぬと断って来ました
Mr. Ito excuses himself on account of illness.

content:
こな〔粉〕
〈名〉
1. (=穀類の粉)flour:(ひき割りなら)meal

content.content: 粉をひく
to grind flour
小麦を粉にひく
to grind wheat into flour―Wheat is ground into flour
粉をふるう
to sift flour
粉ひき場
a mill
粉屋
a miller

content: 2. (=粉末)powder

content.content: 粉にする
to powder anything―reduce anything to powder―pulverize anything
細かい粉
a fine powder
粗い粉
a coarse powder
粉茶
dust tea
粉薬
a powder

content:
こない〔戸内〕
〈副〉Indoors

content.content: 戸内遊戯
indoor games

ごないぎ〔御内儀〕
〈名〉Your wife; your good lady

content:
こないだ〔此間〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: このあいだ〔此間〕

こなぐすり〔粉薬〕
〈名〉A powder

content:
こなごなに〔粉々に〕
〈副〉To pieces

content.content: こなごなに砕く
to break anything to pieces
こなごなに砕ける
to be broken to pieces

content:
こなし
〈名〉(=身体のこなし)Carriage

content.content: あの女は身体のこなしが好い
She carries herself well.

content:
こなしつける
〈他動〉To cry (one) down; to run (one) down; to speak ill of (one)

content.content: 人の言うことを頭からこなしつける
to contradict one flatly―condemn one without a hearing

content:
こなす
〈他動〉
1. (=粉にする)to powder; to reduce (anything) to powder
2. (=消化する)to digest (food)

content.content: 腹をこなす
to digest one's dinner

content:
3. (=けなす)to depreciate; to disparage; to decry; to cry (one) down; to run (one) down; to speak slightingly of (one); to speak ill of (one)
4. (=自在にする)to manage; to master

content.content: 人を使いこなす
to manage a man
暴れ馬を乗りこなす
to manage a mettlesome steed
道具を使いこなす
to master a tool
本を読みこなす
to digest a book
(芝居の)雑役をやりこなす
to humour a difficult part
着物を着こなす
to wear one's clothes nattily―adapt oneself to one's clothes
洋服を上手に着こなす日本婦人は少ない
Few Japanese ladies know how to adapt themselves to foreign clothes.
数でこなす
to make up by numbers

こなた〔此方〕
〈代名詞〉This; this one
〈副〉Here; this way

こなひきば〔粉碾場〕
〈名〉A mill

content:
こなみじんに〔粉微塵に〕
〈副〉To pieces

content.content: 粉みじんに砕く
to break anything to pieces―smash anything to fragments―(爆発してなら)―blow anything to atoms.
粉みじんに砕ける
to be broken to pieces―smashed to fragments―blown to atoms
この崖から落ちようものなら岩に当たって粉みじんに砕けてしまう
If you were to fall over this precipice, you would be dashed to pieces on the rocks below.

content:
こなれ〔消化〕
〈名〉Digestion (of food):(=る) to digest; to be digested

content.content: こなれの好い(悪い)食物
digestible food―indigestible food
胃が悪いと食物がこなれない
When the stomach is disordered, things will not digest.

ごなん〔御難〕
〈名〉(A religious leader's)persecution, suffering, distress; (Christ's) Passion (on the Cross)

content:
ごにち〔後日〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: ごじつ〔後日〕

こにもつ〔小荷物〕
〈名〉A package; a packet

content:
ごにん〔五人〕
〈名〉Five persons

content.content: 先生は五人いる
There are five teachers.
家族五人
There are five of us.
五人がかりで仕事をやってしまった
We have finished the work among us five.
五人組、五人囃し
a quintette

ごにん〔誤認〕
〈名〉Mistake:(=する) to mistake (a man for a burglar); to take (one for a foreigner)

content:
こにんずう〔小人数〕
〈名〉A small number of men; a handful of men; a small family

content.content: 彼は小人数を率いて敵に向かった
He advanced against the enemy with a handful of men.
うちは小人数だから大きな家は要らない
A small family, like ours, does not require a large house.

content:
こぬか〔小糠〕
〈名〉Rice-bran

content.content: 小糠三合持ったら養子に行くな
Do not become an adopted son if you are above sheer beggary.

content:
こぬかあめ〔小糠雨〕
〈名〉A drizzling rain; a drizzle; a mizzle

content.content: 小糠雨が降っている
A drizzling rain is falling―It is drizzling―It is mizzling.

こぬすびと〔小盗人〕
〈名〉A pilferer; a petty thief

こぬすみ〔小盗み〕
〈名〉Pilfering:(=する) to pilfer

content:
こねかえす〔捏ね返す〕
〈他動〉To knead

content.content: 道路はこねかえされてぬかるみになっている
The roads are kneaded into a mire.

こねこ〔小猫〕
〈名〉A kitten:(の呼名は) kitty

content:
こねこ〔捏ね粉〕
〈名〉Dough

content.content: こね粉をこねる
to knead dough

content:
こねる〔捏ねる〕
〈他動〉To knead; to work

content.content: 練粉をこねる
to knead dough
粘土をこねる
to work clay
理屈をこねる
to chop logic
彼は理屈をこねることが好きだ
He is a logic-chopper.
子どもがダダをこねる
A child stamps its feet―A child frets.

content:
この〔此〕
〈指摘形容詞〉This(複数―these); the present

content.content: このお方です
It is this gentleman here―(下等社会に言わせると)―this 'ere gentleman.
この靴は小さ過ぎる
These shoes are too small for me.
この本は方々で使っている
The book is used in many schools.
僕はこの辺は不案内だ
I am a stranger in these parts.
彼はこの二三日病気でいる
He has been ill these two or three days.
この五六日は治るまい
He will not be well these five or six days.
この時も彼は酒に酔っておった
He was drunk again on the present occasion.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: この姿では人前にでられない
I am not fit to be seen.
この人にしてこの子あり
Like father, like son―The son is worthy of the father.
この先どうなることか
What will become of me?
この目でにらんでおいた
I have an eye on him.
あの人の家はどこかこの辺だ
He lives somewhere about here.
このばかめ
You fool!

content:
このあいだ〔此間〕
〈副〉The other day; a short time ago; not long ago; not long since; lately

content.content: この間お目にかかったとき言うのを忘れた
I forgot to tell you when I saw you the other day.
この間中は病気でした
I have lately been ill.
あの人はこの間来たばかりだ
He came only a short time ago―not long ago―not long since.
ついこの間来たばかりだ
It was only lately that he came.
ついこの間逢ったばかりだ
It was only the other day that I met him.
ついこの間のことのようだ
The event is still fresh in my memory.

content:
このうえ〔此上〕
〈副〉
1. (=これより以上)more; further; besides; in addition to this

content.content: この上に借金までもした
In addition to all this, I have run into debt―I am in debt besides.
この上言うことはありません
I have nothing more to say.
この上頂戴しては不愉快になります
I shall feel disagreeable if I drink more.
この上望むものは無い
I have nothing more to wish for.
僕は全力を尽くしているのにこの上望ものは無理だ
I am doing my best. You can not, in reason, expect more.
この上に未だ理由がある
There are further reasons for it.
この上ご厄介になってはすまないから
I should be sorry to impose upon your hospitality any more.
この上とも何分よろしくお願い申します
You will let me continue in your favour.
この上とも御愛顧の程奉願上候
We solicit your continued patronage.

content: 2. (=こうなった以上は)now that (things have come to this)

content.content: この上は言い訳しても駄目だ
It is no use trying to excuse yourself now.
この上はあくまで奮闘するよりほかは無い
Now that things have come to this, we must fight to the bitter end.
この上は城を枕に死ぬのみである
We have now only to make the castle our death-pillow.

content: 〈形〉(=の) above this; better than this; superior to this

content.content: この上の品は望んでも得られぬ
It would be hard to find a better article.
この上の品はありません
A better article is not to be had.
この上の望みは安心して死ぬのみである
My only desire now is to die in peace.

content:
このうえない〔此上無い〕
〈形〉The best, the very best (article); greatest (happiness); utmost (efforts); first-rate (article); tiptop (quality); supreme (happiness); matchless, peerless, unsurpassed (beauty); incomparable (prosperity, etc.)

content.content: これはこの上無い品だ
It is the very best article―a first-rate article.
この上も無き幸せです
It is the greatest happiness that can fall to my lot.
達者なのはこの上無い
Health is above everything else.
この上無い名誉です
It is the highest honour that can be conferred upon me.
彼はこの上無い満足を以て結果をみている
He looks on the result with the utmost satisfaction.
彼はこの上無く悦んでいる
He is overjoyed―He is rejoiced beyond measure―His joy knows no bounds.

content:
このえ〔近衛〕
〈名〉The Imperial Guards; the life-guards

content.content: あれは近衛兵だ
He is a life-guardsman.
近衛師団
The Imperial Guard Division.

content:
このかた〔此方〕
〈前置詞相当〉Since (some event); these (so many years) ［注意］出来事を標準とすれば“since”を用い、時日、年数には“these”を用いる。

content.content: 維新このかた廃れたる日本刀
The Japanese sword has been in disuse since the Restoration.
六十年このかた廃れたる日本刀
The Japanese sword has been in disuse these sixty years.
彼は試験このかた病気でいる
He has been ill since the examination.
二十日このかた病気でいる
He has been ill these twenty days.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: へその緒切ってこのかたこんな目に逢うのは初めてだ
I never had such an experience in my life―in all my born days―in the whole course of my life.
この商売を始めてこのかたこんな事件に出会わすのは初めてだ
I never came across such a case in the whole course of my professional career.
三十年このかたの大雪だ
It is the greatest snowfall that has been seen for thirty years―Such a snowfall has not been known for thirty years.
神代このかた
from the Age of Gods downward

content:
このくらい〔此位〕
〈副〉About this:(量なら)about this much, about so much:(数なら)about so many:(大きさなら)about so large:(長さなら)about so long:(幅なら)about so wide:(厚さなら)about so thick:(深さなら)about so deep

content.content: 大きさはこのくらいある
It is about so large―about this size.
長さはこのくらいある
It is about so long―about this length.
まだこのくらい残っている
There is about this much left―about so much left.
二階にはまだこのくらい本がある
There are about so many books upstairs.
このくらい勉強したらたくさんだろう
If I work so hard, it must be enough.
このくらい書けりゃ結構だ
If you can write so well, it will do.
熱帯地方の暑さもこのくらいのものだろう
The heat of the tropics must be something like this.
台湾のことを思えばこのくらいの暑さは何でもない
This heat is nothing to that of Formosa.
いつもこのくらいあればよい
This much will do every time.
今日はこのくらいにしておきましょう
That'll do for today.

content:
このご〔此後〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: こんご〔今後〕

content:
このごろ〔此頃〕
〈副〉Lately; of late; recently; now; at present

content.content: この頃はよく雨が降る
We have had much rain lately.
この頃は頻々として汽車の椿事が起こる
Railway accidents have been very frequent of late.
この頃は彼に少しも会わない
I have seen nothing of him of late.
彼はついこの頃来たばかりだ
It was only lately―but lately―that he came.
ついこの頃のことだ
It happened but lately―quite recently.
彼が帰朝したのはついこの頃のことだ
It was but lately that he returned from abroad.
彼はこの頃どうしているか
What is he doing now?
この頃は(なにもせず)ただ居る
He is doing nothing at present.

content:
このさい〔此際〕
〈副〉Under the circumstances

content.content: この際仕方がありません
It can't be helped under the circumstances.
この際ですから儀式は全廃致します
Under these circumstances, we shall do away with all ceremony.
この際やかましいことは言っていられない
We must not be particular under the circumstances.

content:
このさき〔此先〕
〈副〉
1. (=此後)hereafter; henceforth; in future

content.content: 父に死なれた時はこの先どうしようかと思いました
When I had my father die, I was at a loss what to do in future.
この先の見込みはどうだ
How are the chances for the future?

content: 2. (=ここから先)beyond this point; farther on

content.content: その町はこの先まだ三里あります
The town is three ri farther on.
この先は一本道だからおわかりになります
Beyond this point, the road runs without branching, and there is no mistaking it.
その医者の家はこの先の横町です
The doctor lives round the corner.

content:
このした〔木の下〕
〈副〉Under a tree

content.content: 木の下陰に
under the shade of a tree
行き暮れて木の下
Belated, 'neath a cherry's shade
陰を宿とせば
A shelter for the night I found;
花や今宵の
And well the fragrant flower played
あるじならまし
The hostess to my slumber sound.

content:
このせつ〔此節〕
〈副〉Now; at present; in these days; in our days; nowadays

content.content: この節は自動車が大はやりだ
Motor-cars are now all the rage.
彼はこの節どうしているか
What is he doing at present?
あのような学者はこの節珍しい
Such scholars are rarely to be met with nowadays.
この節の若い者には珍しい
He is a rare case among young men nowadays.

content:
このたび〔此度〕
〈副〉This time

content.content: このたびはおめでとう
I wish you joy of the occasion.
このたびはお世話になりました
You have been very good to me―you have laid me under an obligation.

content:
このつぎ〔此次〕
〈副〉Next; next time:(=の) next

content.content: この次は僕の番だ
It is my turn next.
この次に説明します
I will explain it next time.
この次に彼に逢ったらそう言おう
(when I meet him next―と言わずして)The next time I meet him, I will say so.
この次にくる時は馬に一駄もお土産を持ってくる
The next time I come I will bring you a horse-load of presents.
この次の日曜にいこう
I shall come next Sunday―on Sunday next.
この次の会はいつ開こうか
When shall we hold the next meeting?

content:
このとおり〔此通り〕
〈副〉Thus; like this; as you see

content.content: この通りに直せ
Correct it thus―like this.
この通り各級はいっぱいです
The classes are all full, as you see.
この通りなかなか骨が折れます
You see it is hard work.
これこの通り下駄が有るじゃないか
Don't you see these clogs?

content:
このとき〔此時〕
〈副〉At this time; then

content.content: この時現われたのが加藤清正
Then there appeared on the scene the form of Kato Kiyomasa.
この時はもう儀式はすんでおった
By this time, the ceremony was over.
恨みを晴らすのはこの時だ
Now is the time, to revenge ourselves.
この時ばかりは閉口した
I never was so nonplussed in my life.
この時早くかの時遅く現われ出でたる一人の怪僧
At this instant, there appeared on the scene a mysterious priest.

content:
こののち〔此後〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: こんご〔今後〕

content:
このは〔木の葉〕
〈名〉The leaves of trees; fallen leaves

content.content: 秋は木の葉が落ちる
The leaves fall―Trees shed their leaves―in autumn.
木の葉は浮く
Leaves float on the water.
木の葉のように浮く
He swims like cork.
敵は秋の木の葉の風に散るが如く逃げた
The enemy fled in confusion like leaves scattered by the autumn wind.
船は波濤のために木の葉のように翻弄された
The ship was tossed about by the sea.
家は木の葉隠れに立つ
The house stands embowered in a thicket.

content:
このば〔此場〕
〈名〉This place

content.content: この場限りの話さ
The matter will go no further―Nobody will be the wiser.
この場限りの話だがあの人はあやしいね
Between ourselves, appearances are against him.
この場に及んで君は後へは退けまい
You can not recede at the eleventh hour.

content:
このぶんでは〔此分では〕
〈副〉At this rate; judging from the present state of things

content.content: この分ではご病気もじきに治りましょう
At this rate, you will soon be well.
この分では花がじきに咲きそうだ
The blossoms will soon be out in this weather.
この分ではとても今日中に行き着けまい
Going at this rate, we shall never get there today.
この分では事がじきにすみそうだ
The thing will soon be over if it goes on at this rate.
この分では君はじきに身代を使い果すだろう
You will soon go through your fortune if you go on at this rate.
この分では先が案じられる
You will come to no good if you go on at this rate―This is a bad sign for your future―This augurs ill for your future.
この分では事がうまく行きそうだ
Judging from the present state of things, the enterprise is likely to be a success―This is a good sign for the success of the enterprise―This augurs well for the success of the enterprise.
この分では事が失敗に帰しそうだ
Judging from the present state of things, the scheme is likely to end in a failure―This is a bad sign for the success of the scheme―This augurs ill for the success of the scheme.
この分では明日は天気になりそうだ
This is a good sign for tomorrow's weather―This augurs well for tomorrow's weather.
この分では明日の天気はむずかしい
This is a bad sign for tomorrow's weather―This augurs ill for tomorrow's weather.

content:
このへん〔此辺〕
〈名〉This neighbourhood; this part of the country; this quarter of the town:(=に) in this neighbourhood; in this part of the country; in this quarter of the town; in these parts; hereabouts; (somewhere) about here

content.content: この辺もだんだん開けますね
This neighbourhood is being opened up.
この辺に明地がありませんか
Is there any vacant ground hereabouts?
彼の家はどこかこの辺だ
He lives somewhere about here.
僕はこの辺は不案内です
I am a stranger in these parts.
この辺に学校があればよい
There ought to be a school in this neighbourhood.
この辺にも今に電車が通じます
The cars will soon be running in this part of the city.
この辺の学校では何本を使っていますか
What books do they use in the schools here?

content:
このほう〔此方〕
〈指摘代名詞〉This one

content.content: この方にします
I will take this one.

content: 〈人称代名詞〉I; we

content.content: この方無事
I am glad to say we are well.

content:
このほど〔此程〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: このあいだ〔此間〕

content:
このま〔木の間〕
〈名〉A glade

content.content: 家は木の間隠れに立つ
The house stands embowered in a thicket.
木の間の隠れの流れ
a stream flowing between the trees
湖水が木の間の隠れに見える
The lake shows fitfully through the trees.
木の間洩れる月影
moonlight filtering through the branches

content:
このまえ〔此前〕
〈副〉Last time:(=の) last

content.content: この前どこまで読みましたか
Where did we leave off last time?
彼にこの前逢ったときは無事であった
(When I met him last time―と言わずして)The last time I met him, he was all right.
この前来たときは君は不在でした
The last time I called, you were out.
この前の日曜に行った
I was there last Sunday―on Sunday last.
この前の手紙で申し上げました通り
as I said in my last (letter)

content:
このましい〔好ましい〕
〈形〉Desirable; fine

content.content: あまり好ましくない地位だ
It is not a very desirable position.
好ましいお子さん方です
You have fine children.
好ましい品だ
It is a fine article.

content:
このまま〔此儘〕
〈副〉As it is

content.content: この家は(手を入れずに)このままにしておこう
I will leave the house as it is.
この家は(こわさずに)このままにしておこう
I will leave the house standing.
資本は(手をつけずに)このままにしておけ
Leave the capital intact.
家はこのままで一万円には売れる
The house will sell for 10,000 yen as it stands.
この顔をこのままに書け
Paint me as I am!
このままここに居ってよろしいか
May I stay where I am?
この事はこのままにはすまされぬ
I can not let the matter drop.
このままには捨ておかれぬ
I can not pass over the matter in silence―pass by the matter unnoticed.

content:
このみ〔好み〕
〈名〉Liking; taste; fancy; choice; preference; predilection; inclination; bent

content.content: 何かお料理のお好みがありませんか
Is there any dish you would like to order?―Do you fancy any particular dish?
別に好みは無い
I have no particular choice.
お好みによっては何でもこしらえます
You shall be served to your liking.
ご註文お好み次第
Served to order.
品はお好み次第です
You can have your choice of the articles.
どちらでもお好みの方をさし上げます
You shall have either you prefer―whichever you prefer―whichever you have a preference for.
専門を選ぶには各自の好みに従うがよい
In choosing a profession, let each man follow his inclination―follow his bent.
読書するには好みによって本を選ぶに限る
In reading, it is best to choose the books by predilection―Read such books as you have a predilection for.
人々の好みに任す
Every man to his taste.

このみ〔木の実〕
〈名〉Fruits; nuts; berries

content:
このむ〔好む〕
〈他動〉To like; to fancy; to choose; to prefer (either); to care for (anything); to delight in (novels); to take kindly to (books); to be fond of (wine); to be partial to (things Western); to have a liking for (anything); to have a fancy for (some dish); to have an inclination for (study); to have a taste for (reading); to have a passion for (sporting); to have a relish for (poetry); to have a weakness for (fine clothes); to have a partiality for (things Western); to have a preference for (either)

content.content: 西洋人は果物を好む
Foreigners like fruit―They are fond of fruit.
僕は支那料理はあまり好まぬ
I don't care much for Chinese food.
君は何か好む料理があるか
Is there any dish you fancy?―Have you a fancy for any dish?
読書を好む人は容易に語学者になれる
One who has a taste for reading, may easily make himself a linguist.
彼はたいそう小説を好む
He delights in novels.
英国人は非常に勝負事を好む
The English have a passion for sporting.
あの少年は学問を好む
The boy has an inclination for study―He takes kindly to his books.
氏は幼きより学を好んだ
He took kindly to his books from his childhood upward.
女は美服を好む
Women are fond of finery―They have a fondness for finery.
男で美服を好む人がある
Some men have a weakness for fine clothes.
日本の文物を好む西洋人がある
Some foreigners are partial to things Japanese.
どちらでも好む方をお取り
Take whichever you prefer―whichever you have a preference for.
弁を好む
to like to make words―like to make oneself heard
敢て弁を好まんや
Not that I like to make myself heard―But how can I be silent?
専門を選ぶには各自好むところに従うべし
In choosing a profession, let each man follow his inclination―follow his bent.
好んで
by choice―of one's own choice
誰も好んで醜い家に住む人は無い
No one will live in an ugly house by choice.
彼女は好んであの人のところへ嫁に行ったのだ
She married him of her own choice.
色を好む
to be amorous―lascivious―lecherous―lewd―lustful
英雄色を好む
The brave are susceptible to female charms.
彼は事を好む
He is quixotic―He will fight windmills.

content:
このめ〔木の芽〕
〈名〉A bud; a leaf-bud

content.content: 木の芽が出る

〈名〉A dead tree

〈名〉A grumbler

content:
こぼす〔零す〕
〈他動〉
1. To spill (ink); to slop (water); to shed (tears); to drop (a tear)

content.content: 涙をこぼす
to shed tears-drop a tear
嬉し涙をこぼす
to shed tears of joy
ありがた涙をこぼす
to shed tears of gratitude
彼女は涙をこぼして嘆願した
She entreated with tears in her eyes.
インキをこぼさないようになさい
Be careful not to spill the ink.
君は着物に茶をこぼしたね
You have spilled your tea on your clothes.
水をこぼしちゃいけない
You must not slop the water on the floor.
こぼした水を拭く
to mop up the slops
こぼしたインキを拭く
to rub off spilt ink
子どもがおまんまをポロポロこぼす
The child drops the rice like rain.

content: 2. (=愚痴をこぼす)to grumble(at bad pay); to complain (of bad treatment); to murmur (at one's proceedings, etc.)

content.content: 彼は不景気だとかなんだとかこぼしづめだ
He is constantly grumbling at the badness of the times, and what not.
仕事が苦しいとてこぼしている
He complains of the strain.
あの女は少しもこぼさずに亭主のいうことを聴いている
She obeys her husband without a murmur.
彼はあのことをさんざんにこぼした
He made a fuss about the matter.
こぼし屋
a grumbler

content:
こぼつ〔毀つ〕
〈他動〉To break; to destroy; to demolish

content.content: 家を毀つ
to demolish a house―pull down a house―take a down a house

content:
こぼね〔小骨〕
〈名〉Small bones

content.content: この魚は小骨が多い
The fish is bony.

〈名〉A windfall; a godsend

content:
こぼれる
〈自動〉(=刃がこぼれる)To be nicked

content.content: 刀の刃がこぼれている
The edge of the sword is nicked.
刃のこぼれた刀
a sword with a nicked edge

content:
こぼれる〔零れる〕
〈自動〉To spill, be spilt; to drop; to fall; to flow; to overflow; to run over; to run out; to brim over; to slop over; to slop out; to be scattered

content.content: 涙がこぼれる
The tears fall―The tears flow―It is so pathetic.
ありがたさに涙がこぼれる
I shed tears of gratitude.
机の上にインキがこぼれている
There is some ink spilt on the desk.
こぼれたインキを拭く
to rub off the spilt ink
茶がこぼれるよ
You will spill the tea.
あまりいっぱいに注ぐとこぼれるよ
If you fill the cup too full, it will brim over.
桶の水がこぼれる
The water in the pail slops out.
水がこぼれている
There are some slops on the floor.
こぼれた水を拭く
to mop up the slops
徳利が割れて酒がこぼれた
The bottle broke, and the wine ran out.
鉄瓶が煮えこぼれる
The kettle is boiling over.
米がポロポロこぼれる
The grains of rice drop like rain.
米がこぼれている
Grains of rice lie scattered on the ground.
種がこぼれる
Plants drop their seeds.
愛嬌こぼれるよう
She is overflowing with smiles.

content:
こほん〔古本〕
〈名〉Second-hand books

content.content: この本は古本で安く買った
I bought the book cheap at second-hand.
古本高価買入
Second-hand books bought at good prices.

content:
こぼんのう〔子煩悩〕
〈名〉One who dotes upon one's children

content.content: お爺さんは子煩悩だ
The old gentleman dotes upon his grandchildren.

content:
こま〔駒〕
〈名〉
1. (=馬の子)a colt; a foal
2. (=小さい馬)a pony
3. (=馬)a horse:(殊に牡馬)a stallion

content.content: 瓢箪から駒
A horse out of a gourd―something bordering on the miraculous.
心の駒
uncontrollable passions
心の駒にむちうつ
to nerve one's heart―nerve oneself
咲いた桜に
Why tie thy steed
なぜ駒繋ぐ
To a blossoming cherry-tree?
駒が勇めば
The horse will prance,
花が散る
The blossoms scattered be.

content: 4. (=三味線などの駒)a bridge

content.content: 駒をかける
to put on the bridge
駒をはずす
to take off the bridge

content: 5. (=将棋の駒)a man; a chessman

こま〔独楽〕
〈名〉A top

content.content: 独楽をまわす
to spin a top
独楽がまわる
A top spins.
独楽をむちうってまわす
to whip a top
独楽が澄む
A top sleeps.
うなる独楽
a humming-top

content:
ごま〔胡麻〕
〈名〉The sesame

content.content: ゴマであえる
to dress vegetables with sesame
ゴマをする
to flatter―toady―sneak
ゴマすり
a flatterer―a sycophant―a toad-eater―a toady―a sneak

content:
ごま〔護摩〕
〈名〉A fire-offering

content.content: 護摩を焚く
to make a fire-offering

こまい〔古米〕
〈名〉Old rice; last year's rice

content:
こまい〔細い〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: こまかい〔細かい〕

こまいぬ〔狛犬〕
〈名〉A figure of a Korean dog (guarding either side of the entrance to a shrine)

content:
こまかい〔細かい〕
〈形〉
1. (=微細な)fine; small

content.content: 細かな粉
a fine powder
細かな木目
fine grain
あの子はきめが細かい
She has a delicate skin―a complexion of the purest grain.
この櫛は歯が細かい
This comb has fine teeth.
活字が細かくて僕には読めない
The print is too small for me.
細かい雨
a drizzling rain―a mizzling rain
細かい雨が降っている
It is drizzling.
細かい銭
small change
細かいのの持ち合わせは無いか
Have you any small change about you?
十円を細かにする
to change a ten-yen note―break a tenner

content: 2. (=詳細な)minute; detailed; circumstantial; full and particular

content.content: 細かな話
a minute account―a detailed account―a full and particular account―a circumstantial account
彼はこと細かに物語った
He gave a minute account―gave a detailed account―gave a full and particular account―gave a circumstantial account―related the full circumstances―gave the full particulars.

content: 3. (=緻密な)minute; nice; delicate; elaborate

content.content: 細かに計算する
to make a minute calculation
細工が細かい
It is delicate workmanship―elaborate workmanship.
あの役者は芸が細かい
His acting is elaborate.
彼は細かいところまで気がつく
He has a nicely observant eye―He is a nice observer.
細かいところまで手が届く
He attends to the minutest details.

content: 4. (=厳密な)strict; close

content.content: 細かに注意して見る
to give close attention to details
細かに改める
to examine closely
あの人は金銭が細かい
He is strict(to the cent)in his dealings.

content: 5. (=吝嗇)miserly; stingly; niggardly; close; near

ごまかし〔誤魔化し〕
〈名〉Deception; trickery; gammon; humbug; juggling; jugglery; hocus-pocus; hokey-pokey; a fake; a camouflage:(=の) humbug; bogus

content.content: ああいう連中はごまかしで世を渡っている
Such men walk through life by trickery―by jugglery.
あの先生のいうことは皆ごまかしだ
What he says is all gammon―humbug.
学生にはそんな誤魔化しは利かぬ
Such humbug will not go down with the students.
ごまかし会社
a bogus company
彼の辞職はごまかしだ
His resignation is a fake.
青い眼鏡は下った目尻を隠すごまかしだ
Tinted glasses are a camouflage to hide ill-set eyes.

content:
ごまかしもの〔誤魔化し物〕
〈名〉A sham; a fake; a questionable article

content.content: この品はごまかし物だ
The article is a fake.

content:
ごまかしや〔誤魔化し屋〕
〈名〉A humbug; a sham; a fraud

content.content: あの先生はごまかし屋だ
He is a humbug.

content:
ごまかす〔誤魔化す〕
〈自他動〉
1. To gammon, humbug, hoodwink, hocus, bamboozle (a person); to put off (a person with fair words); to fake, fake up (a questionable article); to cook, cook up, manipulate (accounts); to fudge (one's work); to gloss over; gloze over; smoothe over (one's fault); to slur over (a fact or a word); to slide over (a delicate subject); to explain away (a difficult passage); to argue away (a knotty point); to manage (a delicate matter); to dodge; to shuffle; to throw dust in one's eyes

content.content: あの先生はよくごまかす
He will gammon you―humbug you―throw dust in your eyes.
自分の間違いをうまくごまかす
He will gloss over his mistake―gloze over his mistakes―smoothe over his mistakes.
むずかしいところをごまかしてしまう
He will slur over a hard word―explain away a difficult passage.
(自分の説に)都合の悪い事実をごまかしてしまう
He will slur over an unfavourable fact.
議論の難点をごまかしてしまう
He will argue away a knotty point.
苦しくなると何とか彼とかごまかして切り抜ける
When he finds himself in hot water, he will dodge and shuffle himself out of the difficulty.
筆の先で帳尻をごまかす
to cook accounts―manipulate accounts
番頭が帳尻をごまかしたのが知れた
The manager was caught cooking the accounts.
営業報告をごまかす銀行がある
Some banks make cooked reports.
仕事をごまかす職人がある
Some workmen fudge their work.
いかさま物をごまかして本物に見せる
to fake up a questionable article
彼は酒に酔っていると言ってその場をごまかした
He said he was drunk to save appearances.
うまいことを言ってごまかされるな
Do not suffer yourself to be put off with fair words.
メートルをごまかす
to tamper with the gas-meter
言いにくいことをあっさりごまかす
to slide over a delicate subject
やりにくいことをうまくごまかす
to manage a delicate matter
どうかごまかしておこう
I will manage it somehow.
舌の先でごまかす
to talk anything away

content: 2. (=着服する) to embezzle, peculate, pocket (money)

content.content: 彼はその金をごまかしてしまった
He pocketed the money.
あの男は会社にいた時ずいぶんごまかしたそうだ
He is said to have peculated large sums―embezzled large sums―while serving in the company.
馬丁が馬の麦をごまかす
The groom steals the horse's oats.

content:
こまく〔鼓膜〕

content.content: 鼓膜を破る

tympanitis

content.content: こまごまと説明する
to explain in detail―give a minute explanation

He gave a minute account―gave a detailed account―gave a full and particular account―gave a circumstantial account―related the whole circumstances―gave the full particulars.
こまごまと書き記す
to write down in detail―note down the full particulars

こまごまに〔細々に〕

content.content: こまごまに引き裂く
to tear to pieces
手紙をふんだくってこまごまに引き裂いた

content:
ごましお〔胡麻塩〕

content.content: 胡麻塩頭

〈名〉Short steps

content.content: 小股に歩く
to walk with short steps―walk with mincing steps―mince one's steps
小股をすくう

content:
こまった〔困った〕
〈形〉Perplexed; embarrassing; awkward; bad; sad; pretty

content.content: 彼は困ったふうをして考えておった
He was thinking with a perplexed air.
これは困ったことだ
This is a bad job―a sad business.
困ったことだ
How awkward!―What an awkward situation!
困ったことができた
Here is an embarrassing turn of affairs―Here is a nice mess―Here's a rum go―Here's a go―What a go!
困ったことになった
Things have come to a pretty pass!―That things should come to this!
困ったことには相手は有名な悪党だ

お前は困った奴だ
I don't know what to do with you―I can do nothing with you.
あれは困った奴だ

始終遊んでばかりいて困った奴だ
A pretty fellow to be playing all the time!

content:
こまっちゃくれた
〈形〉Precocious; forward; pert

content.content: あの家にこまっちゃくれた若い女中がいる

僕はこまっちゃくれた子どもは嫌いだ
I don't like a precocious child―a forward child―an old head on young shoulders.

こまつばら〔小松原〕
〈名〉An avenue of young pines

content:
こまぬく〔拱く〕
〈他動〉To fold

content.content: 腕をこまねく、手をこまねく
to fold one's arms
手をこまねいて傍観する
to look on with folded arms―remain an unconcerned spectator―stand an idle spectator―sit a mere spectator
手をこまねいて傍観するに忍びぬ
I can not remain an idle spectator.
彼は腕をこまねいて思案に暮れておった
He was lost in thought with his arms folded.

content:
ごまのはい〔護摩の灰〕
〈名〉(The old name for) a pickpocket (on the Tokaido)

content.content: ごまの灰につけられる
to be shadowed by a pickpocket

content:
ごまめ〔伍真米〕
〈名〉Dried sardines

content.content: (しかし我々がこんなことを言っても)ごまめの歯ぎしりだ
But all this is impotent rage.

content:
こまもの〔小間物〕
〈名〉Fancy goods; trinkets; haberdashery; gimcracks; knick-knacks

content.content: 小間物屋
a fancy-goods shop―a haberdasher
酔って小間店を出した(へどを吐いた)
He get drunk, and cast up―threw up.

こまやか〔細やか〕
〈形〉Fine; minute

content:
こまやか〔濃やか〕
〈形〉Warm (affection); tender (love); close (friendship); affectionate (disposition); rich (perfume); fragrant (flower, etc.)

content.content: 濃やかな情
warm affection―tender passion
濃やかな交誼
close friendship
情交日に濃やかなり
Their friendship daily grows closer.
女は男より情が濃やかだ
Woman is more affectionate than man.
女の匂い濃やかなり
The flowers give out a rich perfume.
青葉の匂い濃やかなり
The air is redolent of fragrant verdure.

content:
こまらせる〔困らせる〕
〈他動〉To annoy; to bother; to pester; to plague

content.content: 彼は僕を困らせようと思ってわざとあんなことをするのだ
He does such things on purpose to annoy me.
生徒がむつかしい質問をして先生を困らせて悦んでいる
The students take a malicious pleasure in bothering him with hard questions.
彼らはいろいろな無心をして僕を困らせる
They pester me with various requests.

content:
こまりきる〔困り切る〕
〈自動〉To be at one's wits' end; to be in a fix

content.content: あの男には困りきった
I do not know what to do with him―I can do nothing with him.
彼は借金で困りきっている
He is over head and ears in debt.
彼は学資が途絶して困りきっている
He is at his wits' end by having his supply of school-ewpenses stopped.
金を使い果たして困りきっている
I have spent all my money, and I am in a fix.

content:
こまりぬく〔困り抜く〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: こまりきる〔困り切る〕

content:
こまりはてる〔困り果てる〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: こまりきる〔困り切る〕

content:
こまりもの〔困り者〕
〈名〉A scapegrace; a ne'er-do-well; a sad dog; an incorrigible man

content.content: お前たちはいたずらばかりして困り者だ
You are a scapegrace.
彼女の亭主は道楽で困り者だ
Her husband is a sad dog.
彼は幾度失敗しても懲り性の無い困り者だ
He is an incorrigible man.
彼は遊び好きの勉強嫌いで困り者だ
He is fond of pleasure and averse to work―a ne'er-do-well.

content:
こまる〔困る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=困難する)to suffer; to be troubled; to be distressed; to be embarrassed; to be hard put to it; to have trouble (to do something); to have much ado (to do something)

content.content: 寒い時は貧民が困る
The poor suffer in winter.
商人は不景気で困っている
The tradesman are suffering from the badness of the times.
降雨欠乏のため農家が困っている
The crops are suffering from want of rain.
僕は便秘して困る
I suffer from constipation―I am troubled with constipation.
時々頭痛がして困る
I suffer from frequent headaches―I am troubled with frequent headaches.
僕は油足で困る
I am troubled with greasy feet.
僕は困ったことができた
I am in trouble―in great trouble.
困った時は俺のところへ来い
When you are in trouble, come to me―When you need a friend,remember that you have one in me.
困った時はお互いに力になり合おうや
Let us stand by each other in the day of trouble―in time of need.
彼は困っている友人を見捨てるような人でない
He is not the man to desert a friend in trouble―to leave you in the lurch.
困ったことには相手は無頼漢だ
The trouble is, that we have to do with a scamp.
彼が死んで遺族が困っている
His family is distressed by his death.
彼が死んだら遺族が困るであろう
His death will fall heavily on his family.
あの家は今困っている(難渋している)
The family is in distress.
彼は細君に死なれて非常に困っている
He is greatly distressed―terribly cut up―by the death of his wife.
彼は財政に困っている(財政困難)
He is embarrassed in his affairs―in financial embarrassment―in pecuniary difficulties.
彼は家族を養うに困っている
He is hard put to it to support his family.
言葉が通じなくて困った
I had great trouble to make myself understood―I had much ado to make myself understood―I could not make myself understood.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 君がいなくなると僕は困る
I shall miss you very much.
独身もよいが病気でもすると困る
It is all very well to remain a bachelor, but it will go hard with you if you should fall ill.
たださえ困ったところへ病人までもできた
To make matters worse, one of them fell ill.

content: 2. (=困却する)to be perplexed; to be in a fix; to be in a dilemma; to be in extremity; to be in despair; to be at one's wits' end; to be at a loss (what to do)

content.content: 処置に困った
What shall I do?―What is to be done?―I do not know what to do―I am at a loss how to act―I am perplexed.
いやはや困った奴だ
Oh, dear, dear! What shall I do with him?―I don't know what to do with him―I can do nothing with him.
お前には実に困る
I don't know what to do with you―You will be the death of me.
子どもの処置に困った
What shall I do with the child?―I do not know what to do with the child―I am at a loss how to dispose of the child.
不意をうたれて返答に困った
Taken by surprise, I was at a loss for an answer.
百方手を尽してもその効無く僕も困りきった
I have tried every means in vain, and I am at my wits' end.
金を使い果たして困り果てた
I have spent all my money, and I am in a fix.
この金を取れば大罪、取らなけりゃ滅亡、実に困った
If I take the money, I shall commit a crime; if I don't, I shall be ruined―I am in a dilemma.
困った時の神頼み
One will pray to the gods in extremity.
今度こそはいよいよ困った
I am in despair.
あの人は困ったと言ったことが無い
He was never known to despair.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: これは困ったことだ
This is a bad job―a sad business.
困ったことができた
Here is a go―Here is a rum go―When a go!
困ったら俺のところへ来い
When you need a friend, remember that you have one in me.

content: 3. (=困窮する)to be straitened; to be pressed (for money); to be hard up (for money); to be badly off; to be in difficulties; to be in straits

content.content: 彼は暮らしに困っている
He is in straitened circumstances―badly off.
僕は金に困っている
I am pressed for money―hard up(for money).
あの会社は資金に困っている
The company is pressed for funds―badly off for funds.
彼は借金で困っている
He is in difficulties―pecuniary difficulties.
僕が借金で困っている時に彼が助けてくれた
He helped me out of my difficulties.
彼は学資が途絶えて非常に困っている
He is in great straits by having his supply of school-expenses stopped.
そんなに困っているなら、なぜ僕に頼みに来ないのかしら
If he is in such straits, why does he not come to me?

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 彼は免職になったら食うに困るだろう
If he loses his place, he will have nothing to live on.
彼は職に離れてて困っている
He is out of employment, and has nothing to live on.
彼が死んだら遺族は困るだろう
His death will fall heavily on his family.
遺族は食うに困らぬ
His family are well left―well provided for.

content: 4. (=迷惑する)to be inconvenienced; to be put to inconvenience; to be annoyed; to be bothered; to be placed in an awkward situation

content.content: 彼が欠席して非常に困った
His absence put us to great inconvenience―We missed him very much.
金を返してくれないと僕は困るね
You will inconvenience me if you will not pay me.
今日に限って便船が出ないと、そりゃ困ったね
The steamer not sailing today? That's awkward―What an awkward situation!
今君に去られては困る
It would be awkward to have you leave now―I don't like you to leave now.
君には困るね
You annoy me―You bother me.
実に困るね
It is so annoying―How annoying!

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: それではほかの者が困るではないか
Then,where do the others come in?
僕が困るじゃないか
Where do I come in?
あんな奴といっしょにされちゃ困る
I don't like to be lumped with such fellows―I object to being classed with such men.
(その上病気だと)そりゃなお困る
So much the worse.
君はそんなことをすると後で困るぞ
If you take such a step, you will be sorry for it afterward.
いやで幸い、好かれちゃ困る
I am glad you don't like me; I should be sorry if you did.

content: 5. (=当惑する)to be puzzled; to be floored; to be gravelled

content.content: 僕の質問には先生が困った
My question puzzled my teacher.
この問題には誰も皆困った
This problem floored everybody―gravelled everybody.

content: 6. (=困ると言う)to complain of (anything)

content.content: 彼は暑くて困ると言っている
He complains of the heat.
時々頭痛がして困ると言っている
He complains of frequent headaches.
貧乏で困ると言っている
He complains of his poverty.
金が無くて困ると言っている
He complains of want of money.
生徒が怠けて困ると言っている
He complains of the students' idleness.
仕事が苦しくて困ると言っている
He complains of the strain.

content: 7. Must; must not

content.content: 職務を怠っては困る
You must not neglect your duties―You must attend to your duties.
遅刻しては困る
You must not be late for school.
契約を守ってくれなくては困る
You must keep to your agreement.
今時分そんなことを言い出しては困る
You must not say such things at this time of day.
あまり勉強して肺病にでもなってくれては困る
You must not work yourself into consumption.
忙しい時邪魔をしては困る
You must not intrude on my time.

content: 8. Will; will not

content.content: 娘がわがままで困る
She will have everything her own way.
彼らは時を嫌わずに来ては勉強の妨げをして困る
They will come at all sorts of hours, and disturb me in my studies.
彼は医者に止められても酒を飲んで困る
He will drink in spite of his doctor's warning.
おまえは聞き分けが無くて困る
You will not listen to reason.

content: 9. Can not; can not get over

content.content: 言葉が通じなくて困った
I could not make my―self understood.
先生の言うことがわからなくて困った
I could not understand him.
その人の名がどうしても思い出せなくて困っている
I can not, for the life of me, recollect his name.
この子は勉強が嫌いで困る
He can not get over his dislike to study.
僕は臆病で困る
I can not get over my timidity.
娘ははにかみ屋で困ります
She can not get over her shyness.
この風邪が治らなくて困る
I can not get over my cold.

content: 10. Too; enough

content.content: うちの人は気長で困ります
He is too deliberate.
お前は気短かで困る
You are too quick-tempered.
彼は怠け者で困る
He is too lazy.
先生は講義が早くて困る
He speaks too fast.
生徒は出席が不同で困る
The students are too irregular in their attendance.
生徒の学力が不同で困る
The students are too unequal in their scholarship.
そう改まっては困る
You stand too much on ceremony.
(そんなことは子どもに教えなくとも)今に覚えて困る
He will learn it soon enough.

content:
11. 
〈英語に訳さぬ場合〉

content.content: この子は無作法で困ります
He has no manners at all.
話し相手が無くて困る
I have no one to talk to.
相談相手が無くて困る
I am thrown upon my own resources.
彼は不身持で困る
He is a sad dog―a loose fish.
お前は朝寝坊で困る
You are a sluggard.
この子は甘ったれで困る
The child is spoilt―He is a spoilt child.
この子はいたずらで困る
The child is always in mischief.
風邪を引いてはなが出て困る
I have caught cold, and my nose is always running.
僕は板挟みになって実に困る
I find myself between two fires.
年のせいか忘れっぽくなって困る
I find I am growing old―my memory fails me.
僕の言うことをそういちいち冷やかされちゃ困る
You make fun of everything I say.
僕は悪筆で困る
I write a poor hand.
近頃は天気が悪くて困るね
The weather has been very bad of late.
しけで困りますね
There is a great scarcity of fish.
水が切れて困る
There is water-famine.

to clear the water from impurities

to sweep out the litter

to sweep the litter into a heap
道路は芥が立つ

to brush away the dust

to dump rubbish
浮世の芥を洗い流そう

dusty―worldly―of the earth, earthy

content:
こみあう〔込み合う〕
〈自動〉(People) crowd, throng, press; (a car) is crowded; (a room) is packed; (the entrance) is jammed

content.content: 今時分は電車が込み合う
The cars are crowded at this time of day.
電車が込み合って乗れなっかった
I could not get into the crowded car.
込み合いますから中程へ願います
Please go into the middle, we are so crowded.
乗る人や降りる人で非常に込み合う
What between those trying to get in and those trying to get out, there is a great crowd.
通りは馬車や自動車で込み合っている
The street is crowded with carriages and motor-cars.
表は押すな押すなと込み合っている
There is a jostling crowd in front of the house.
芝居の木戸口が込み合う
The door of the theatre is jammed.
木戸口がいつも込み合う
There is always a jam at the door.
芝居は大入りで込み合っている
The house is packed―There is a full house.
人の込み合うところへは行かないようになさい
You must avoid places where people crowd.

こみあげる〔込み上げる〕
〈自動〉

3. (=胸に満つる)to fill one's heart:(人を主格とすれば)to be filled with (some emotion); to have a fit of (some emotion)

content.content: 無念さが込み上げてきた

content:
こみいった〔込み入った〕

content.content: 込み入った事件だ

話の筋が込み入ってくる(談佳境に入る)

content:
こめる〔込める〕

1. (=装填する)to load (a gun)

content.content: 鉄砲に弾を込める
to load a gun with a bullet

content: 2. (=算入する)to include

content.content: この勘定には雑費が込めてある
The account includes the expenses.
雑費を込めて五百円になる
The whole amounts to 500 yen,inclusive of expenses.

content: 3. (=集中する)to concentrate (one's powers on anything); to devote (oneself to anything)

content.content: 一心を込める
to concentrate one's mind on anything

to devote oneself to―give oneself to―one's studies
彼は心を込めて勉強している
He is intent on his studies.
力を込める
to concentrate one's powers on anything
一念込めて祈った
I prayed with devotion.

content:
ごめん〔御免〕
〈名〉
1. (=ご赦免)your pardon

content.content: (悪いことをした時)まっぴらご免なさい
I beg your pardon―(芝居では)―I cry mercy.
(座を立つ時)ちょっとご免
Excuse me (for a moment)!
(人の前を通る時)ご免なさい
Please let me by!
間違ったらご免なさい
I shall beg your pardon if I am mistaken.

content: 2. (=許可)(your) permission, leave

content.content: ご免をこうむって一言申し述べます
With your permission,―By your leave,―I shall speak just a word.
(人の家から帰る時)これでご免をこうむります
I shall take my leave―(芝居なら)―I humbly take my leave.
ご免をこうむって寝ます
I shall go to bet, if you please.
ご免を被って中へ入ろう
I shall make bold to go in.
斬り捨てご免
the samurai's privilege to cut down an insolent commoner.

content: 3. (=免除) excuse (from a task)

content.content: 僕は任に堪えないからご免をこうむりたい
I must excuse myself from the task―I wish to be excused from the task―for I am unequal to it.
皆ご免をこうむると言って手を引いた
Everybody excused himself from the task―begged off the task―cried off the task.
まあご免こうむりやしょう
I'd rather be excused.
酒はご免だ
You must excuse me from drinking.
長たらしい演説はご免だ
Save me from a lengthy speech!
お世話焼きはご免
“Save me from my friends.”
危ぶない山はご免だ
I don't care to run risks.
その話はもうご免だ
I don't care to hear that subject mentioned.
夜学はご免をこうむる
I must excuse myself from teaching evenings―You must excuse me from teaching evenings.
そんなことをするのはまっぴらご免だ
I would not do such a thing for the world―Nothing shall induce me to do such a thing.
そのお付合いはまっぴらご免だ
I won't go with you in that―Nothing can induce me to go with you in that.
あんなお客はまっぴらご免だ
I bless myself from such customers.
何でも致しますがそればかりはまっぴらご免
I would do anything but that.
どこへでも参りますがそこばかりはまっぴらご免
I would go anywhere but there.
そんな物は熨斗を付けられてもまっぴらご免だ
I would not have it at a gift.
戦争はもうまっぴらご免だ
We have had enough of wars―We deprecate more wars.
彼女はまっぴらご免だというような顔をして僕を見た
She looked at me with a deprecatory countenance.
そんな事件に関係するのはまっぴらご免だ
I will have nothing to do with such an affair.
あんな改まった席はまっぴらご免だ
I can't stand such a formal company.
木戸御免
freedom of the wrestling-hall
あの人は木戸御免だ
He is free of the hall―on the free list.

content:
ごめんこうむる〔御免蒙る〕
〈自他動〉

content.content: ご免こうむって一言申し述べます
With your permission,―By your leave,―I shall speak just one word.
ご免こうむって寝ます

ご免こうむって中へ入ろう

content.content: これでご免こうむります
I shall take my leave―(芝居では)―I humbly take my leave.

content: 3. (=免除を乞う) to excuse oneself from (a task); to beg off; cry off (a task)

content.content: 僕は任に堪えないからご免こうむりたい
I must excuse myself from the task―I wish to be excused from the task―for I am unequal to it.
皆ご免こうむると言って手を引いた
Everybody excused himself from the task―begged off the task―cried off the task.
まあ僕はご免こうむりやしょう
I'd rather be excused―I beg off―I cry off.
酒はご免こうむる
You must excuse me from drinking.
夜学はご免こうむる
I must excuse myself from teaching evenings―You must excuse me from teaching evenings.

content:
ごめんそう〔御面相〕
〈名〉Features; looks

content.content: ひどいご面相だ
She is a fright―a perfect fright.
あのご面相で芸者をするとは
That such a fright should court public favour!

content:
こも〔菰〕
〈名〉A rush-mat; a straw-mat:(総称すれば)straw-matting

content.content: こもを着て寝る
to sleep under a straw-mat
おこもさん
a beggar
こも包み
a package wrapped in straw-matting
こもかぶり
a large sake cask wrapped in straw-matting
死骸をこもにくるんで河へ捨てた
The body was wrapped in a met and thrown into a river.

こもかぶり〔菰被り〕
〈名〉A large sake cask wrapped in straw-matting

ごもくならべ〔五目並べ〕
〈名〉(The game erroneously called) gobang

ごもくめし〔五目飯〕
〈名〉Rice boiled with fish and vegetables

content:
こもごも〔交々〕
〈副〉
1. (=かわるがわる)alternately; by turns; one after the other
2. (=相次いで)in succession; one after another

content.content: 内憂外患交々到る
Internal and external troubles follow one another―“One woe doth tread on another's heels.”

content:
こもち〔子持ち〕
〈名〉
1. (=妊娠)pregnancy

content.content: 子持魚
a seed-fish
子持箸
half-split chopsticks with a toothpick inserted between them

content:
2. (=妊婦)a pregnant woman; a woman with child
3. (=子のあること)motherhood; maternity:(男なら)fatherhood; paternity
4. (=子のある人)a mother; a father

content.content: あの人は子持ちだ
He is a father―He has a family―He is a family man.
あの女は三人の子持ちだ
She is the mother of three children.

content:
こもづつみ〔菰包み〕
〈名〉A package wrapped in straw-matting

content.content: こも包みにする
to wrap anything in straw-matting

content:
ごもっとも〔御尤も〕
〈形〉(Your conduct is―Your words are) reasonable

content.content: そうおっしゃるのはご尤も
You may well say that―You have good reason to say that.
ご腹立はご尤も
You may well be angry―You have good reason to take offence.
おおせはいちおうご尤もだが私は私だけの考えがあります
What you say, is all very well,―all very fine,―but I have my own views on the subject.
ご無理ご尤も
Yes, it is “very like a whale.”

content:
こもり〔子守り〕
〈名〉(事)dry-nursing:(人)a (dry) nurse; a nurse-maid:(=する) to dry-nurse (a child); to take charge of (a child)

content.content: 誰が子守りをするか
Who has charge of the child?―Who is in charge of the child?
子守りの預かっている子ども
the nurse's charge
子守歌
a nursery song―a lullaby
子守歌を歌って子どもを寝かす
to sing a child to sleep

content:
こもる〔籠る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=人がこもる)to shut oneself up; to seclude oneself

content.content: 彼は終日一室にこもっている
He shuts himself up in his room all day.
山寺にこもる
to seclude oneself in a mountain temple
城にこもる
to sustain a siege
神殿にこもる(おこもりする)
to stay at a temple for days to worship

content: 2. (=室内などがこもる)to be close; to be fusty; to be stuffy

content.content: 室内がこもっている
The room is close―The room is fusty―The room is stuffy.
こもった室にいるのは体に好くない
It is bad for the health to live in a fusty room―in a stuffy room.
室内にたばこの煙がこもっている
The room is full of tobacco smoke.
息がこもる
The air grows foul.
熱が体内にこもっている
The fever is raging inside.

content: 3. (=含蓄される)to be implied

content.content: この言葉には言外の意味がこもっている
The word implies some other meaning―There is some other meaning implied in the word.
意味のこもった言葉
a word pregnant with meaning―a significant word
情のこもった言葉
loving words
熱情のこもった言葉
impassioned language
彼の言葉には一言一句熱誠がこもっている
His words breathe of sincerity―Every word he utters is instinct with sincerity.

あの人は顧問が付かないと話ができない

a foreign adviser to the Educational Department
宮中顧問
a court councillor
枢密院顧問官
a privy

content.content: 宮中顧問官
